Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: pfeeley82
Reviews.Content: This is a nice friendly hotel just two minutes walk from Piazza San Marco. Good room if slightly dated in style but perfectly adequate with a comfortable bed, a mini bar, air conditioning and a reasonable shower in the bathroom. Our room was on the fourth floor giving a view across the rooftops to the Campanile. Good breakfast. Very friendly and helpful staff. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “A good value during "low"-season, best for 1st timers...”
Reviews.Author: TravelinDandy
Reviews.Content: CONDITIONS OF STAY: -3 night stay in 2008 (originally 4 but we took a surprise trip at the end) -stayed in a standard double "comfort" room at the AAA-rate of 69euro/night -This is my wife's favorite city and as a result we have gone multiple times. FIRST IMPRESSON: As other have noted, this hotel is in an ideal location for first-time visitors to Venice. Located about a 5-7 minute walk from the S. Marco/S. Zaccaria vaporetto stop, this hotel is about as close as you can get to walking right into your hotel from the water without actually staying in one of the hotels along the shore line. While it IS tucked away in one of Venice's classic narrow streets, there is a sign on the corner of that street with an arrow to follow to the hotel. (From the vaporetto stop, walk through Piazza San Marco keeping to your right, take a right around the basilica and you are there, basically). When you walk in the hotel, you'll notice a particular style that is common to Venetian hotels, I'll call it "Venetian Yard Sale". Alot of "antique" looking furniture, gold/brass trimmings, carpets and wall paper with designs on them. It's cute and charming (my wife adored it) and I don't mean to make it sound negative. It is NOT dingy or dirty. The service is warm (in fact the service led to one of our best vacation nights ever) and their English is very good (as is the case in all of the popular city hotels of Italy), you need not worry about communicating in broken Italian (though it does go a long way:). Checking in was not a problem. To the left of the reception area is a bar and the dining room where they serve the complimentary breakfast buffet. THE ROOM: I have seen the pics from other reviewers, and I have to say, it looks like we lucked out. Ours was a modest size, but the layout utilized the space well. Again, this was a double "comfort" room, so perhaps the rooms are bigger than the singles? They are decorated in the same fashion as the lobby...sort of like being in a doll house. The room was clean and the best was comfortable enough. As for the bathroom, it was small but clean. The views from our room were not interesting as this hotel is landlocked and surrounded by other buildings. YOU WILL NOT SEE CANALS FROM YOUR WINDOWS. If that is important to you, choose another hotel. FOOD: As stated before, this hotel includes breakfast with most of their reservations it seems. And while it is the standard bread/cheese/cold cuts/cereal/coffee-buffet common in Italy, it has proven to be the best of it's kind in all of the hotels I've stayed at in Italy. Also, there is a small bar in the hotel, and while most tourists will probably never use it, we did have a night where my wife and I came back late and the gentleman manning the desk started pouring us massive servings of grappa for free. That was amazing. So it definitely is a perk to have around. Since you are in a central area, there is no shortage of food, though I also suggest walking a ways from the hotel as the nearby establishments are even more tourist-trappy than usual (Venice, frankly, is inundated with bad food, but there are some real great, "locals-only" places, you just have to search). MISCELLANEOUS: One thing to remember, you are in the San Marco area, which is the home of many of the major tourist attractions (the Basilica, Campanile, and Doge's Palace). In other words, this place gets CROWDED. Also, if you like to take advantage of off-season traveling like we do, know that this area can also get badly flooded during "high water"-season. One major plus: Venice's "street-sign" system is aided by numerous signs that point the direction to the major areas like Piazza San Marco (in fact, you can be all the way in the Ghetto and see signs for San Marco). This was great peace of mind for us on our first visit as Venice's many alleys and bridges can take you in circles if you aren't careful. VALUE: This is the real issue with this hotel. We were able to get this room during low season at a great rate. However, just having gone to Venice this last February (2012), I can attest to this hotel sometimes going for upwards of 200euro/night, even more. As I do a random search right now, I'm finding it over 150/night in June. Having been back to Venice and knowing it to some degree, you quickly learn that what you are paying for at this hotel is ease and location. There are MUCH better hotels you can get at a cheaper rate if what you care about is comfort and charm. You just have to look in areas like Dosoduro, Santa Croce, or any of the other neighborhoods. There are even some other Best Westerns in Venice to choose from. FINAL THOUGHTS: Remember, in Venice, you really never are but a short walk from something amazing or picturesque. Therefore, if you are a savvy traveler or don't mind doing a little homework/walking, you will be better served by looking up hotels outside of the Piazza San Marco area. However, if what you need is peace of mind in the knowledge that your kids will be able to find their way back to the hotel, then this hotel is a good choice. Just don't pay over 120euro/night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeannieBeans
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our hotel, it was in a very convenient location, easy to find, just behind St Marks Square. The hotel room was clean, roomy and pleasant, we had a triple bedroom, with a lift to the floors too. The staff were friendly, informative and very accomodating and helped us when we needed it, they suggested some trips we should make. The breakfasts were delicious with lots of choice and the food was fresh and topped up regularly. The rooms were cleaned and our bed linen and towels were changed every day and when we were out in the evening the shutters were closed and the beds was turned down. I could not fault this hotel at all and I recommend this hotel for it's good value and for being superb. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and grotty bedroom”
Reviews.Author: Maria R
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend last week to this hotel, and the bedroom looked like a grotty ship cabin...veryyy tiny, old fashioned and a bit scruffy. The bathroom and toilet were quite good and clean(however if you are big person you will struggle to use it, its not very big as well). The staff and the location great, and the continental breakfast was not too bad. I dont think the size of the room was value for money, it was like a single room for a double room prize. Its not the worst hotel I have ever been, however if you go for a romantic weekend with your partner, I will recommend you to spend a bit more of money and take him to a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: RHSRebel
Reviews.Content: Never met a friendlier bunch at the front desk; helpful throughout the stay and had a great sense of humor; hotel is just 1-2 minutes from St. Mark Square; you can see and hear the bell towers from your room; Room was one one of the more spacious I have seen in my times in Italy; breakfast was good; not great but very solid; take water bus to Rialto bridge and it is a 5 minute walk to the hotel; saves you taking the water bus all the way around to St. Mark Square; did offer a free boat trip to Murano glass factory; was fun but was quasi high pressured sales pitch to buy something from Murano; we did not and the folks there at the factory were not happy Will not look elsewhere when we return; will book here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Hauxton
Reviews.Content: Close to main sights being some 2 minutes from Piazza San Marco. Hotel was in typical tourist Venetian style - plenty of ornate furniture and glass chandeliers - and the staff were very friendly. For instance, we wanted another pillow and it arrived 3 minutes later. The room was very clean - as was the bathroom. Possibly a little cramped (as are most places in Venice) but who stays in their room (other than to sleep) when in Venice ! Breakfast buffet style and good choice of items. We paid GBP 88 a night (via the EasyJet site) which I consider fair value for money. I've paid a lot more for less in the past in Venice. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “That personal touch”
Reviews.Author: 451Chrissy60
Reviews.Content: Took just ten minutes to walk there from the waterbus stop in San Marco. Quiet even though it was La Carnevale. Room cleaned every day with fresh bed linen and towels plus beds were turned down at night. The staff remembered you every time you returned - not once did I have to ask for my key- they knew me. All the staff courteous and nothing was too much trouble. Room could have been a wee bit bigger but you're in Venice and everywhere is small. However we had an amazing balcony with enormous windows and shutters. Easy to get to sights. So convenient and I started the day with a good breakfast. I would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Darshwana
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in the Montecarlo Best Western hotel in Venice. The hotel has just an excellent location â€“ it is situated very close to the San Marco square and Basilica. It is also within a short walking distance (ca. 5 minutes) from the Rialto Bridge. Rooms are quite small but very pleasant & cozy with stylish and nice furniture â€“ I liked our room very much. We had our room on the 2nd floor but I would recommend for everyone to take a room on the 4 th (or at least 3 rd floor) to have a nice view. The building opposite to the hotel is 2 floors high, so I think that in case of having a nice view the 4 th and 3 rd floors are just the best option. The best view ever is from the room no 410 (that room has one big bed and not two single beds). Breakfast is served as open-BF and we found it really good. We were also offered a complimentary tour to Murano glass factory and it was a very nice tour â€“ I am very happy we took it. The staff in the hotel was also very nice and helpful. However the real low point (weak point) was internet wi-fi connection. It worked so badly that sometimes I was simply not able to connect with any web side or call via Skype etc. I believe that the hotel should really improve it, as I found the same complain from other people staying in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: grosminet42
Reviews.Content: 3 minutes walk to San Marco piazza, very polite and helpfull staff,good value,close to restaurants and shops,would definitely recommend, i would return there.

Reviews.Title: “1minute from plaza san marco”
Reviews.Author: Bratislaava
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, romantic furniture in rooms, 1 minute walk from the main square where we went for carneval, good breakfast, but when we woke late they did not add all the missing food. We were satisfied as we were so close to san marco and the romantic atmosphere inside room was also great, just bathroom was a little old and therefore did not look perfectly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful staff, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DSuttonRN
Reviews.Content: weren't sure what to expect in Venice, but this hotel served us well, although it is quite worn and dated. We, hysterically, "upgraded furnishing" from dated to schizophrenic, which is the general Venetion style. Would love to have seen what the non-updated rooms looked like. Tiny tiny rooms and worn carpets, but beds were crisp and bathrooms quite clean. Location was excellent with easy access to both St Mark's and short walk to Rialto. Our first time to Venice ( for a January birthday)put us in shock with the size of what constitutes a street.This hotel is in an alley the width of which you couldn't fit two trash cans but fairly easy to locate. Once off the "street", the hotel was bright and welcoming with great front desk staff. Breakfast was ample and back breakfast room was lovely, like an antique dining train car. If you want to walk the alleys and get lost, January is the time with lower rates and more competition. You can linger on the bridges and shoot pictures forever.. walk unjostled and never wait to get in anywhere. Take a short walk from this hotel to the Hard Rock off St Mark's around 5 and sit at the windows to watch the gondoliers in the "parking lot" scheme and get paid by their "manager".

Reviews.Title: “Very Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Europetraveller2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location but thats where the positives end. Even though, the hotel is a part of the Best WEstern Chain, I was exptremely disappointed. The hotel is dingy and looks more like a 2 star hotel. The wallpaper was peeling off, the air conditioning was'nt working and the hotel staff was downright rude.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice and Hotel Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: KJMN828
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Montecarlo as part of a Delta Vacations package and were very happy with the choice. Great rate and comfortable hotel. The hotel is in a great location - 2 minutes from St. Mark's. The breakfast was great - lots of choices, great coffee, plenty of tables. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Bathroom was clean and modern. Great shower. Room decorations are dated, but charming. Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in class”
Reviews.Author: KuldeepSharma_11
Reviews.Content: it was great expeience there. Nice hotel. it was very approachable and yet close to major attractions in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: ConteAlmaviva
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel at a bargain price for bed and breakfast which is ideally placed between the Rialto and San Marco, then the Montecarlo is the place to stay. Like many Venetian hotels it is small and has only a tiny bar and some chairs in reception, but the staff are exceptionally helpful and the rooms are spotlessly clean; bed linen is changed everyday. Make sure that you book and pay in advance to get the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: DebCEssex
Reviews.Content: We needed a room that slept 3 adults and were nervous that we would end up with a camp bed as the third, however we were given a double and twin room with a shared bathroom that was perfect for us. As everyone has said the location is fantastic, so close to all the main attractions and only a three minute walk from the vaparetto. The breakfast was good and substantial, the sheets and towels changed each day and the staff were great, particularly Marco and Dario who were so helpful, knowledgable and completely charming that they made our stay in this beautiful city absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: OldWorldEurope
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights prior to a leaving on a cruise in November 2011. The hotel is just steps away from St. Marks but in a very quiet location. We arrived in the morning and our room was ready. Our room was larger than many we've had in the US. We had a king-size bed and plenty of room to walk around (we've stayed in another hotel in Venice where one of us would have to sit on the bed so the other could walk by). We liked the Venitian decor and our room had a beautiful chandelier and armoir. The bathroom was totally modern with a great shower. The room had heat and A/C, but we chose to sleep with the windows slightly open and enjoy the cool air. They have a very small bar area (more of a counter) but will make you anything on request I think. One evening when we came in after dinner we talked to the hotel staff about a cappucino and they called one of the other staff members to do that. We sat in a sitting room and were served our cappucinos with 2 little cookies. A great end to the day! (This room was off the lobby and also had a PC for hotel guests.) The breakfast was very good and included the usual assortment of meats, breads, cereals, etc. They had a cappucino machine that actually made good coffee. The hotel staff was very friendly. We did have a minor complaint - we asked for extra pillows, but there was some confusion with housekeeping and they ended up turning down the bed at night instead of giving us extra pillows. The room was very clean and we had huge, thick towels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: plakmt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my elderly mother in November, 2011. Took public boat from airport to San Marco Square. I used AT&T Android smartphone GPS to direct us to the proper walkway off the square plus about 50 steps and we were in the hotel. Leisurely walk in the other direction led us to Ponte di Rialto. Staff was most helpful recovering purse left on Alitalia flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Angie R
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were upgraded to a bigger room - which was still small. Rooms were clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were on the 1st floor overlooking the street, very noisy. Reception were happy to move us if we wished. The free Wifi wouldn't work in our room and only worked occasionally in the lobby- apparently they had trouble with Telecom? Breakfast was included and was OK. Venice is expensive, this hotel was about 98 Euro/night on booking.com. We moved across the road to Panda Hotel after our 2 nights as we stayed an extra night and got that room for 59 Euro - nice room aswell and less cost - Staff not as nice as the Monte Carlo though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelMiddlesex
Reviews.Content: Myself and daughter stayed here in September 2011. Although it was a little difficult to find ( true of many locations in Venice) The welcome we received was so professional and courteous. Our room was wonderful and my daughter loved that the mirror in the bathroom de-misted so quickly ( to allow for applying make-up!!) Once we got our bearings,we realised what a perfect location. A few minutes walk to San Marco, the Rialto Bridge etc. We didn't need to use water buses or taxis,we just walked everywere,which makes Venice so appealing. Staff were so helpful and arranged a walking tour that we wanted. They also provided a free trip to Murano and the glass factory, which was wonderful. Unfortunately, too expensive for our budget. Would definitely stay at this hotel again. 'Brilliant'

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there unless you plan on carrying your luggage everywhere you go. It's not secure!”
Reviews.Author: Burgerwars
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend staying there for one reason: The place is not secure, and I have a feeling there are thieves on the staff. First issue is they don't yet use electronic card key locks. Second is they give you a key on a giant key chain, and request that you leave it at the front desk every time you leave. They're very polite and helpful, but now they know who's coming and going. When you come back you ask for the key. Several times it's with a person at the desk you haven't met before, but they'll give you the key. Just say your room number. How can they be sure it's you? I came back to the room the last afternoon I was there and left again for a couple of hours. I came back early because of a 3:40 am waterbus I had to catch to the airport. I leave my suitcase in the room locked with one of those TSA locks (probably master keys are everywhere or can easily be picked). I noticed when I came back my luggage was slightly moved from where I left it, but didn't think anything of it. When packing the next morning, I noticed a plastic bag I kept inside the luggage in a side compartment with a bunch of spare euro coins and U.S. coins I didn't feel like carrying around, was stolen. I am very consciences where I put my stuff, so it wasn't misplaced elsewhere. In fact, before going out for the last time that afternoon, I took some euro change out of the bag and left it on a table in the room for the housekeeper's tip the next day. They didn't take that money, so I took that back. No tip for the housekeeper now. I didn't feel like arguing with the person at the front desk, since it was 3:00 am, and I had a boat to catch. I didn't want aggrivate myself. I'll never set foot in this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JaqueRJ
Reviews.Content: Considering that Venice is "tight" I found this hotel an excellent cost / benefit. Very well located. The room is reasonable, good bathroom, some parts of the hotel have been refurbished and the breakfast very good for the local standard. The only hitch was the internet connection, but considering that we were surrounded by water on all sides, was even reasonable. If you do not take your laptop the hotel provides complimentary computer in loby. Staff muitpo helpful. Beware of free excursion to Murano because the intent is to make you spend there. It has several places in town that sell pieces of Murano at more affordable prices.I do not give better qualification, as there is air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Fair Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ace4444
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located among the warrens of alleys around St. Marco. It's difficult to locate and doesn't look like much, but the proximity to so many things makes it worthwhile. The facility is a bit dated. The rooms were ok, but didn't have a view. We asked for a dinner recommendation at the desk and later felt like we'd been set up. Breakfast was included but was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: AvistonSue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo 2 days prior to boarding a cruise around Italy in October 20, 2011. We were a group of 10 couples in our mid 50's. What a wonderful experience we had to start our first trip to Italy. The staff was so helpful and courtious, even with such a large group of guests. Our travel agent arranged to have the hotel handle our transfers from the airport and then again to the cruise port for embarkation. Even though our flight arrived an hour late we were met with a friendly welcome. Everyone was very helpful with our many pieces of luggage even though we had only booked transfers and not luggage assistance. The counter staff, bellmen, housekeeping and breakfast staff were amazing. The food was excellent and coffee was great. Our room was spacious and clean, for an older building, street was quiet ,but steps away from St. Mark's, and restaurants and shops were very close as well. The hotel staff arranged for a great tour of the Murano glass factory on the Island of Murano, which was well worth the visit. The hotel has a nice lounge area to visit or check your e-mail, which was very nice for us since all of us couldn't fit into a room to visit. I hope we have the opportunity to visit Venice again and if so, we would definetly return to the hotel Montecarlo. Thank you, Susanne from Illinois

Reviews.Title: “Can't even get a booking”
Reviews.Author: tvlgrl11
Reviews.Content: I emailed the hotel to book 10 rooms for my group and received a response that they don't take group bookings which is shocking. So emailed again and ask to simply get 10 individual rates. Again my request declined. How can any hotel decline to book a reservation much less a group of them. Never mind then as this shows the type of horrible customer service my money wont be spent here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RLWOrangePark
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel conveniently located in the heart of Venice tourist area but on a side street so did not get the noise or congestion of St Markâ€™s Square. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Hotel room was very nice and breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of meats, cheeses, breads and pastries. While this is a Best Western, donâ€™t confuse it with quality of hotels in that chain in the United States. Best Westerns in Europe use the chain only for reservation system. The many Best Westerns weâ€™ve stayed at in Europe are high quality and offer the same amenities as higher priced hotel chains. Only complaint I had with the hotel is when I called down to the front desk to ask if I could come down and get a real wine glass (so that we could have a bottle of wine in the room), I was told that I would have to buy the wine in the bar and so we had to drink out of plastic cups vice real glasses.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite hidden away, but very central”
Reviews.Author: jd2412
Reviews.Content: Arriving by private water taxi was extravagant, but I dont think that we would have found this hotel too easily otherwise. Although centraly located, if you have not been to Venice before finding this hotel (and othrs in the same street) would not have been straightforward - although when you get your bearings it is easy to find! (Getting lost in the very walkable Venice can be half of the fun - stumbling across small campo (squares) and lovely restaurants or fine palaces) The room that we had was of a comfortable size overlooking the small street and a number of shops with half a dozen or more restaurants close by, so if your windows are open the street noise does get in - the double glazing defeats most noise, other than the local and central church bells (silent overnight). If you want to read in bed, dont try as the bed side wall lamps are not quite bright enough, but there is a handly desk lamp thet is. You are in Venice, so the fact that the TV only has one English channel (CNN) on offer is not a drawback. The room was cleaned daily, comfortably furnished with ample storage for two and even had a mini bar (at a Venetian price). Although there is no restaurant on site there is a small bar and orient express themed breakfast room where an ample continental style breakfast along with several hot dishes are served. The coffee on offerr at breakfast is not to write home about though. Friendly and helpful staff. For an exceptionaly expensive city this is a bit of a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: egg222
Reviews.Content: Location could hardly be better - 50 yards North of st Mark's Basilica. Excellent breakfast. Clean rooms. Free wifi. Good restaurants either side. Will come here again if I am ever in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Old & dirty”
Reviews.Author: Licenciada
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing about this hotel is the location. It is very convinent from waterbus, take the stop to San Marco square, head toward the Basilica, make a left at "American Grill" and you're a few yards from the hotel. Great if you are pulling luggage around. Once you get to the hotel, however, you'll find the hotel is very old, damp, dingy and plain creepy. We stayed on the 4th floor and the ceiling was very low. My husband is over 6 feet tall, and almost hit his head. The bathroom was scary, old, and moldy. I am not typically a hotel-snob, but this was worse than any motels I've stayed at. If you are booking this for romance, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: sumsum929
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the San Marco area. The staff was very helpful. Definitely will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: clarner86
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night break at this hotel and would thoroughly recommend it. It is just behind St Marks square and so convenient whether using the vaporetto or walking in Venice. Everything is to hand in the area. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel facilities excellent. I would give this a higher rating than the 3 star. I would certainly use this hotel again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Centre!”
Reviews.Author: Bergerac
Reviews.Content: There are no less than nine Best Western Hotels in and around Venice, so make sure you know where you are going! This one has an excellent situation down a narrow calle (the Venetian word for road) just 50 metres from Piazza San Marco. Most of the thousands of visitors who flock to Venice are day trippers, but actually staying in the city centre is a much better experience. To step out of the hotel and find yourself right in the middle of the hustle and bustle is exhilarating. The rooms are furnished in an elegant Venetian style, with good bathrooms. There was a minibar but no room safe. We were unlucky enough to be put in a smoking room, although we had expressed a preference for non-smoking when we made the booking. There was no airconditioning, only a fan. As we were in the middle of a heatwave, this was totally inadequate. Our room was on the top floor and the heat had been beating on the roof all day. A very unpleasant night ensued! The next day, to our great relief, we were moved to a non-smoking airconditioned room. What a difference! So be warned. There is a buffet breakfast. The reception staff are very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Monte Carlo Venice, Italy”
Reviews.Author: carmenwtx
Reviews.Content: Great locale, easy access, great staff, great rooms. Helpful with directions. Id stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for saving us from an otherwise bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: Retrofix
Reviews.Content: We were diverted here after being overbooked in the hotel Noemi (see related review! ) and have to say we think they did us a favour. This hotel is right next to san marco, and we have a massive, air conditioned room. Great selection for breakfast too. The very helpful guy at reception also called the hotel Noemi for me when they tried to charge me for a no show despite it being them who couldn't honour my booking?? The only criticism is that when the room above moved about it made our chandelier rattle quite a lot, which did affect our much needed siesta! Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel, Great Value/Location”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelGirl11756
Reviews.Content: Front desk personnel were lovely. They were very welcoming and accomodating throughout our short stay in Venice. They helped with reservations, and directions, and also provided free internet usage with a computer that is located in the "breakfast" area. Rooms were delightful! Very Venetian style, with good size bathrooms. TV had many channels (only CNN was in English, but we didnt spend much time in the room) Breakfast had many choices, constantly replenished. Wouldnt hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, dodgy service”
Reviews.Author: AussieBlazers
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms in this hotel for our visit to Venice in June. One of the rooms was recently renovated, well airconditioned, and nicely decorated and had twin beds for our kids. The second room was the opposite, run down, hot/muggy, and is desperate need of an upgrade. We spoke to the reception desk and they offered to move us to another room. We accepted and went through the hassle of moving and the new room was larger but had all the same issues. The one other gripe we had was that the reception staff almost insist that ou take their free tour of the Murano glass factory. The factory that they take you to is interesting but followed up by the inevitable hard sell to buy glass products. We did not purchase anything, and later determined that most of what was on offer at the recommended factory was at least twice the price of other shops at Murano. The one saving grace is that the hotel is very well located near all the attractions in Venice, which makes it ok for a very short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel very near Plaza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: delpat95
Reviews.Content: Our stay was pleasant in the Montecarlo hotel. All the receptionists are very kind, helpful, fluent in many languages (French, English, German ...). The rooms are nice, somewhat small (but we are in Venice!), but nicely decorated. Ask for the quiet side, otherwise you will be on the street side overlooking one of the "street" going to Plaza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “A Slendid Place for a First Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: W0rthyTraveller
Reviews.Content: As a family of three we approached the choice of accommodation in Venice with sort of trepidation. You can never be sure what is set out in any brochure can be relied upon. On this occasion it could. The Montecarlo nestles in a narrow side street approx 100 yds from St Marks square. It has no real frontage. Or pool. Or, comfy lounge. But do not be put off. For a first expereince of Venice this is marvellous. The rooms may not be big. But are very clean & contain all you require for a pleasant stay. Sheets are changed almost every day. And, the rooms are air conditioned. Very desirable. The staff could not be more helpful. The reception managers speak most languges fluently. Always say Good Morning & Evening each time. And, frankly, can handle or arrange any trip you wish. In particular, a free trip to Murano Glass is avaliable at the moment. You are collected from a point near the hotel by power boat & whisked off to see glass blown. And with an opportunity to purchase if you wish. We were waiting for a hard sell. But it did not come. come. Take this offer if you can. Breakfast at the hotel is fine. Pleanty of freshly prepared food. Eg fresh fruit salad, fresh croissants, etc. All replenished regularly. Unlike some places. Breakfats staff could not be more polite & helpful. As were the chambermaids. As long as you intend to spend most of your time away from base - this hotel is outstanding. It does not have views. But you don't really need them. Ask for a room at the back to avoid undue noise. We did not experience any however. It cannot compete with the big hotels overlloking the canal. But that is not what it is about. A warning about Venice. It is the most expensive resort in the world. We likened it to a casino in Las Vegas where you have a handful of euros in one hand continually feeding 'the machine' but never winning. You will get fed up of the waiters enticing you into the nearby restaurants. Almost all the food is the same. If you want anything special it will cost. Beware St Marks square prices! If you sit down at a table with waiter in white jacket there is an immediate supplement of E5.75 per person. Then the cost of drinks which are breathtaking. Two bottles of beer & an orange drink cost E50.00! Everything in Venice comes at a price. Even the WC's -which it has to be said are not plentiful. And cost E1.50 pp. A savings plan in the area of Rialto Bridge is to buy a bottle of water at a restaurant fo approx E4.50 - you can then use their toilet free. Much better. The Vaparetto (Water Bus) is magic. If you are there for a week buy the weekly ticket for E50.00. This seems a lot but isn't. We spent many hours just travelling back & forth on the bus seeing the sights. Often up to 2 hours at a time. Most effective. The sights in the square are superb. But to avoid the queues which run all day - see the Doges & Basilica on separate days & at late afternoon. Much easier. There is also a general 'CHURCHES' ticket you can pick up for E20.00 which gives you access to all the places where normally there wd be charge. Buy one! Montecarlo Hotel greatly recommended. Everyone needs to experience Venice once. You must do so. But we predict you will return home with substantially less cash than when you arrived! It is the nature of the beast..

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TotoahBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in July 2011, loved it. Right beside St Marks Square, decent sized room and bathroom, very helpful staff on reception. The queues at the train station are a bit painful to get through but once you get past that you'll soon see that it was worth waiting for. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “This is a little jewel of a hotel in a perfect location right off St Mark's Square!”
Reviews.Author: ggyItalia
Reviews.Content: Actually, I've stayed there three times and put my friends in that hotel when they come to Italy. I live an hour outside of Venice so it is my hotel of choice when I want to spend the night in Venice. It is a small, unpretentious historical property with a marvelous staff at the front desk. The rooms were clean and the location, well, you simply cannot beat it for the price! For American visitors: not all the bathrooms are large and spacious. But, I have to ask: are you going to Venice to take long showers in a luxurious bathroom or are you going to visit one of the most beautiful and romantic cities in the world? For you shoppers who love the Murano glass jewelry beads: you'll find all sorts of glass bead shops in the area where you can choose your beads and the shop people will string them for you either while you wait... or you can pop around the corner for a quick coffee in one of the surrounding cafes. They make marvelous memory gifts that won't break your budget.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: wendyLakeland_fl
Reviews.Content: if you fly into venice, sign up for the venice connect card, then once in venice,it's easy hop on boat and get off whereever you want. the hotel is very easy to get to from the st. mark's sq. check in was quick and easy and they are really helpful at front desk. the room is small but, not overly so. bathroom nice and clean.the hotel is so easy to do sightseeing and then return to room to rest or get out of heat. would stay there again if ever lucky enough to vist venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Started Out Great But Ended On a Bad Note”
Reviews.Author: Hooverfan
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the hotel staff was more than friendly and extremely helpful. They let us check in early as our room was ready. It was considered a jr. suite and perfect for my grandson and me as we each had a small room. My bed was not very comfortable but my expectations were not high either so it was fine. Room was clean, but did not cool off very well and totally without a view, just rooftops. That was fine, too, because the location more than made up for it. Very close to everything, just a short walk to St. Mark's Square. I guess you should consider all of the above when making a decision about the hotel because now comes the bad experience that ruined it for me. The a.m. clerk was really a jerk. We had asked for a 6 o'clock wake up call and also a water taxi at 6:30. When we got downstairs at 6:10 expecting a cup of coffee and danish, we were told it was not open until 7. Looked totally open with the danish and cereal all laid out and ready to serve, but we understood the 7 a.m. serving thing. Then a vendor delivered a fresh container of fruit, and I asked the clerk if we might have a piece to go. He said no that it was not washed yet? What?? I kept my cool and we sat there in the small lobby until 6:30 waiting for the water taxi. During this time the clerk was not doing anything and we were the only ones around. All of this time I thought we had paid at the time of the booking when I submitted my credit card information. So after 20 minutes of just sitting there, at 6:30 we picked up our suitcases and were ready to leave for the taxi, he told me we had not paid and needed to pay our bill, I handed him the same credit card I always use. He made a swipe and said it did not work so I gave him another one even though I had just used the card the night before and knew perfectly well it worked fine. Again, he said the second card did not work. I told him that one of them needed to since that was all I had, and he asked me "Do you want me to try swiping in a different machine?" What? Why would he not have tried that before? I looked at the counter and saw that there were several cc machines and wondered why he didn't do that to begin with. Anway, he did and the card worked fine. I was pretty frustrated and annoyed at this point that such a morning ruined an otherwise pleasant visit. This was actually a case of an obviously inexperienced employee who had poor judgment skills.

Reviews.Title: “"Super place! would definitely recommend"”
Reviews.Author: wendy_kingsbury
Reviews.Content: More than we could have hoped for - especially for the price! Every single staff member was more than helpful, the rooms were great, the view amazing as was the location! Literally 2 minutes walk from St Mark's square, restaurants, shops and much much more. Don't even worry about the noise! We will be returning for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we'll stay again”
Reviews.Author: mespinar
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Expedia with my basic requirement of close to St Mark's Square and had an elevator and included breakfast. My this place was so much more!!! We loved the location, so close to everything. The breakfast was great, I loved the expresso machine so you could make your coffee as you like it. Our room was very clean, no view but I didn't expect one for the price and the bath was large and modern. We were treated to a free water taxi ride to Murano and then on to Burano, what a blast. After we shopped on Burano and had lunch we walked to the Vaporetto stop and caught the water bus back to St Marks. A lovely day trip for a nominal price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuroTrip2011
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, the rooms quaint but clean with all the amenities. Breakfast was excellent. The location was perfect - close to Piazza San Marco - very easy to find. Took the Aliguna Water Bus to the piazza and it was just a short walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal....”
Reviews.Author: Seasonedtraveller071
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice right near St.Marks Square. Very warm welcome and efficient, no fuss check in. Bags taken to room immediately. Room smallish as expected, but very clean and had all we wanted except mini safe. Bathroom with shower and bath was spotlessly clean and had plenty of hot water! Breakfast was fine with a good choice of pastries, fruit, scrambled egg, sausages, etc.... Coffee was via self service machine, but perfectly good. All in all, great value for Venice, great location, good happy staff. If we return to Venice, would consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Near St Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: ananddavid
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly as described. Our room was at the back of the hotel which made it nice and quiet. We only used the room to sleep and to come back to in the afternoon to change and have a rest before dinner. The room was spacious enough and there was a large wardrobe with plenty of shelving for clothes storage. The bed was very comfortable with beautiful clean white cotton sheets each night - lovely. Although the bathroom was on the small side, it did have a bath with a good shower over it. The air conditioning worked very well, we just left it on low all the time as it was very warm whilst we were there. The hotel is in a super position for sightseeing, so central it couldn't be better. We took a water bus from the airport and just followed the hotel directions, it's less than a 5 minute walk from the water bus even with suitcases. Breakfast is self service, continental style, but with scrambled eggs and sausages on the hotplate. Plenty of fruit, cheese and ham, pastries etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, 1st Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IMJIN
Reviews.Content: We have been to Venice a number of times, just wish we had stayed here on previous visits. The location couldn`t be better, the staff were very helpful and always had a smile. The room was lovely and spacious (214) clean sheets every day and a turn down service. Breakfast was plentiful and in pleasant dining room. Just one thing there is no coffee/tea facilities in room. This is general in Venice hotels, take a travel kettle etc. if you enjoy an ealy morning cuppa.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, knowledgeable and friendly front office staff”
Reviews.Author: Gaye89
Reviews.Content: Not more than a couple of minutes walk from the Basilica of San Marco and 15 minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge. Rooms are clean, comfortable with ensuite. Unfortunately their tv reception, particularly of the BBC, is poor, but hey are you going to Venice to watch tv? Their front office staff were fabulous - very knowledgeable, friendly with excellent local tips at their fingertips. No restaurant but they provide a continental breakfast. However they have links with the restaurant next door which offers a reduced rate to guests of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Katie-1946
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were excellent, welcoming, charming and extremely helpful, I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff & surprisingly good breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: arransue
Reviews.Content: We were a family group travelling with elderly parents. We had a stressful experience (lost passport) before arriving at the hotel and the welcome we received was so warm & reassuring - just what we needed. Hotel easy to get to by Vaparetto from Santa Lucia railway station along Grand Canal (route no 1 - to S Marco Vallaresso) which was a perfect and exciting introduction to Venice. Hotel is on narrow street off St Marks Square but once located is easy enough to find each time. Easy walking distance to all main tourist attractions but also easy to get off the main tourist trek and find lovely quiet squares, smaller canals, bridges and alleyways.Impressed with breakfast - lots of choice & unlimited good coffee etc from machine. Breakfast room was busy but staff very efficient and happy to join tables together to accommodate our party of 6. Rooms were small; double bed in 2 of the rooms against the wall was not ideal; shower room clean, spacious & great shower! Small but functional bar area which included internet access (not sure if there was a charge?). Didn't use restaurant but extensive menu - a bit more expensive than restaurants in surrounding area. We took up the offer from the hotel of a 'free' boat trip to Murano Island. We enjoyed trip over to the island (about 15 mins) & glass blowing demonstrations but found the 'hard' sell which followed rather tedious as we had no intention of buying any of the overpriced glassware. In conclusion, the highlights of this hotel were the location and all the staff - chambermaids, breakfast room and bar staff and reception staff who were all welcoming and helpful (reception staff went out of their way to help us with paperwork about missing passport).

Reviews.Title: “Five star service in three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozzywoz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem located close to Piazza San Marco. The staff cannot do enough especially the front desk manager who was brilliant. I was taken I'll on this trip and they couldn't do enough even offering to cook me a light meal (free of charge) out of hours. Add to this free wireless Internet in your room and a more than adequate buffet breakfast. Would I stay there again - definitely

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: wurtz77
Reviews.Content: This trip actually took place in July of 2009 as my best friends and I traveled Italy. For the price this hotel's location can not be beat. We found the staff to be helpful and the room was suffice. It was def. the smallest on our trip and it was tight room for 3 guys. Barely any room to walk with our luggage out. But I would recommend this hotel as the value and location make up for the size of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: EalingTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. The room was a good size, very clean and presentable. Buffet breakfast was verg good, lots to choose from. Importantly it was only 1 minutes walk from San Marco square. Great plus point if you fly to Marco Polo airport and get the waterbus to San Marco square you havent got far to take bags. I would stay again without hesitation. Â£75 a night including breakfast, super value.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, better location.”
Reviews.Author: okiegreen
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Monte Carlo is a gem of a hotel. The rooms are small, but very clean. The location is right at Saint Mark Square and an easy walk to the Rialto Bridge. The English of the hotel desk is excellent and they are a joy to deal with. Wish we could have spent more time with them. Breakfast was excellent. The little bar is perfect. Woulodn't stay anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Total value for money !!”
Reviews.Author: AngusWBA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel Montecarlo in Feb 2011. I have to say, as far as value for money goes, this place was top of the pile! The location is as good as you'll get, anywhere in this wonderful city. The rooms are clean, tidy and fairly spacious. there was an excellent choice of breakfast on offer and the staff were both friendly and helpful to your everyday needs. If you are either traveling as a couple or in a fairly small party/group I would fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR VALUE”
Reviews.Author: nabilafarhat
Reviews.Content: great hotel for price close to the san marcos square

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: stetsonbob_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here October 3-4, prior to a cruise. We arrived early in the day and they looked after our luggage while we went for lunch. Like all European hotels, the room was small according to North American standards but extremely clean and comfortable. The hotel is about one and a half blocks from St. Marks Square. The included breakfast was incredible including scrambled eggs, sausages, pastries and rolls, and hot coffee with hot milk. The desk arranged for a complimentary visit for us and our friends to the famous glass works. For the morning of our full day in Venice at our request they arranged for a well qualified guide for us for a four hour walk around Venice including taking us to areas and squares not normally visited by tourists as well as passing the line to visit the Dodge's Palace. We awoke the morning of our departure at 8:30 a.m. to the sound of a loud siren which we learned was a warning of a combined high tide and high wind from North Africa. By 10:30 a.m. not only was St. Marks Square completely flooded, but the flooding had extended one block up to the first street above the Square. When we checked out and arranged to meet the motor boat to take us to the cruise ship, we had to meet it at a small canal about a block away. The porter accompanied us with the luggage and helped to load the luggage on the boat. Complete courtesy. R. J. LeClerc

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: billyboy
Reviews.Content: If you like a nice view from your bedroom window, then this hotel is not for you. Situated, as it is, in a narrow street surrounded by buildings, your outlook is most likely to be a wall or at best rooftops. If, on the other hand, you want a room that is spotlessly clean, nicely carpeted and curtained, well furnished and with very comfortable beds, plus an equally clean bathroom with full sized bath, ultra efficient shower, sensible sized washbasin, bidet and WC, then this hotel will meet your requirements and more. In any case, who in their right mind would travel to Venice to sit in a hotel bedroom?! Others have commented on the great location and close proximity to Piazza San Marco, the excellent breakfasts and the first class reception staff. I agree entirely with these comments and particularly so in respect of the front office staff who happily and speedily answered questions and gave useful directions by email, well in advance of our arrival. It does not come cheap - like everything else in Venice - but it is value for money and is to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located, steps from Piazza di San Marco. Their breakfast is quite nice. Rooms are not too small, and have traditional Venetian decoration style. service at the front desk was responsive at all times.

Reviews.Title: “best location to see all of San Marco square at own pace .”
Reviews.Author: ARtraveler65
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 5 minutes from the square. Perfect to explore and then to return to rest when the cruise ship tours come in, and then go out again. Our room was a corner with a view of the roof tops. Bath was standard with tub and shower . The breakfast was large and varied. The staff were friendly and informative. When we checked out we still did not need to leave until 4pm. They put our suitcases up at the desk for us to pick up later. Easy access to the water bus ,then to the bus terminal to the air port.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Venice for Seniors”
Reviews.Author: jelliclegypsy
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took my mom to Italy for her 80th BD - we visited Rome and Venice. Mom uses a walker or cane, (we brought both) so we were worried about her getting around in Venice. The water busses were no problem for her to maneuver, as the folks there helped her on and off. We stayed at the Best Western Montecarlo - it was a perfect location and didn't overextend our budget. It is very walkable from the waterbus stop; she took it slowly with her rollator walker, and we carried her luggage. The hotel's location is a 3-5 minute walk to San Marco Square. There are plenty of shops and restaurants just outside the hotel, so there was no need to travel far if she didn't feel like it. During the day, when she forgot something, we could run right back to the hotel to retrieve it. The hotel has a lift, so she didn't have to climb stairs - it is a very small lift - fits no more than 3 people, but served its purpose. We reserved a triple. The room was adequate, clean and had a sturdy bar in the tub for her to hold when showering. The bathroom though clean was a bit outdated with orange tile in the shower. The only other negative was the occasional noise coming from the water pipes. The staff was courteous and accommodating and a great help with planning excursions. We took their advice on which gondola ride to try and were extremely pleased. Mom also enjoyed the tour the hotel offered to the Murano Glass Factory. The breakfast was generous; she found plenty of enjoyable choices. She fell in love with Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ifbourg
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really very good as it takes place near S. Marco square. The staff is friendly and helpful, speaking several languages. The breakfast room is beautiful with many food choices. I liked that after check out I could leave my luggage in the hotel without charge. The only tiring thing is that as it is not possible to get close to the hotel by car /boat , i had to carry my luggage myself through San Marco to get the boat .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: barkk
Reviews.Content: BW is central and only 2 streets away from St. Marc's square. The rooms were nice, clean and sufficient. Desk staff very helpful and pleasant. For about $230 US per night, including breakfast such a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Quality family run establishment, 1 minute from San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Tricky273
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to this hotel and I know the hotel inspector, Alex Polizzi, would say it is in the detail. Yes the hotel is showing some signs of the need for an update and redecoration. Our room was number 412, on the top floor with no real view. Some of the wallpaper was peeling, the grouting in the shower needed attention, and the room itself was small. But all of these pail into insignificance when compared with the quality level of service from this family run establishment. The reception team were excellent, the breakfast service was attentive, and we spent some time with the chambermaid as she cleaned up our room (thank you very much, I did feel guilty how we could mess the room up so quickly, so left a handsome tip!!). The room was comfortable, clean and provided all the facilities we required as a tourist. You have to remember this is an old building and as we were advised by the receptionist on our arrival, "the lift is small and slow, but this is venice". The massive pluses with the hotel are the attentive quality service (we never had to ask for our room key and received help with a number of questions) and the location, 1 minute from the famous square surrounded by shops and restaurants. This was my fourth and my wife's seventh visit to Venice. This time we decided to walk off the normal tourist areas - in particular Santa Croce, San Polo and Castello. You get to see a truer version of Venice and there are some lovely bars and tavernas here - cheaper than the main tourist areas. Castello around the Arsenal and to the Isola Di S. Elena again offer a real vision of Venetian life. One place you must visit is the clock tower or Torre dell'Orologio - Please do not confuse with the campanile. The Torre dell'Orologio is the clock tower from the 14th century to the left of the Basilica San Marco topped by the statues of two "Moors" and a large bell. You can only visit this by reserving a place at the Museo Correr which is at the western end of the Piazza San Marco. The cost is 12 euros each, but this does include entrance to the Museo Correr, which is well worth an hour or two. But a trip up the clock tower is fantastic. And once you get to the top, the views of San Marco are really unique. I love Venice and i will visit again with my wife and I would definitely return to this small, quality and friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value centrally located hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: merlymoo
Reviews.Content: Think the title of my review says it all! We have just returnedd from our second stay at this hotel (my 7th trip to Venice) and we would not hesitate to recommend it to friends. It is quite literally ONE minute from St Marks Square. Last time we visited (6 years ago) we had our son with us and therefore got a bigger room. I have read reviews on here by whinging Americans who complain about the size of the room - this is not America where everything is huge, this is a 17th century building! When I visit Venice I spend my time walking, seeing the sights and eating in fantastic trattorias ....not sitting in my hotel room grumbling about the size. Another issue that some people on this site have with this hotel is the lack of "view" You will not get a view of St Marks Square or the Grand Canal, if you want that pay another few hundred quid a night and stay elsewhere. The view from our room (412) was typically Venetian, lots of rooftops and belltowers. Breakfast is included and has something for everyone. It is good to be able to fill your belly before you set out on mammoth walking expeditions as we did. We found, once again, all staff to be helpful and friendly, especially the two gentlemen who worked reception during our visit. Each time we visit Venice we see something new or visit a different part of the city. This time we took a tour to the top of the clock tower (NOT the bell tower) the one with the the 2 men striking the bell - a great tour and the views from the top were excellent, although I would say the guide got the balance between talking and letting us take photos from the roof a little wrong. We also took a walking tour called "ghosts and legends" which was very interesting and took us off the beaten track. Currently there is a lot of restoration work being done which is obviously a good thing, unfortunately lots of the hoardings covering the work were hideous, the bridge of sighs is surrounded by a Coke advertising and a building at the entrance to St Marks Square was covered in Breitling advertising. If this had been my first visit, I may have been disappointed by this. Will I visit Venice again? YOU BET. Will I stay at the Hotel Montecarlo again? YES.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: flo_geyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just behind the Piazza San Marco. The room was small, but OK for Venice. The breakfast room was also, typical Venice, small, but a good start in the morning. The price was high, but if you consider the location, it was reasonable. Our room was in the highest floor, and we could see the Campanile from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful and Friendly Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveItaly2010_10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here, so close to St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge. It was easy to find from the Ailaguna, just walked through St Marks Square with your luggage and through the Streets. The staff were so obliging and friendly to us. The room was spacious and with beautiful traditional Chandeliers. The breakfast was continental and throughly delicious! So close to all the souvenir shops, leather, clothes shops. Also, some great restaurants, to cater all budgets. Also, to avoid the mini bar prices, there is a little Gelato kiosk further up on the same street as the hotel which sell water and cans of drink. Hope you enjoy your stay too!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good service”
Reviews.Author: FellowTravellers2010
Reviews.Content: Just a few minutes' walk from San Marco, the Montecarlo is perfectly located. Triple rooms were of adequate size, breakfast (included in the price) was reasonable and the staff extremely helpful and cheerful. Then there is the location ...

Reviews.Title: “For the room we got, this is a (bad) joke...”
Reviews.Author: First_time_in_Venice
Reviews.Content: Thank god we were only in this hotel for one night. The room we got (408) smelled mold. It was really really bad. It is also the smallest room I've ever seen (even for EU and Venice standard, it's not our first time in venice) and it is not worth what we paid for it. A couple of interesting things besides the mold: the 4th floor is not very high. My husband (6ft4in) had to be careful to enter the room and the bathroom. For the size, I am uploading 3 pictures. You will see the whole room and understand what I mean. My sister and her husband paid the same price and got a room on the 1st floor (105). This was much better: bigger and no smell of mold. Breakfast is below average. When my husband and I arrived 1st at breakfast and asked for a table of 4, wde could clearly see on the waitress' face that she was not happy: there were at least 3 tables for 4 that were available, but she managed to complain, and barely pointed one in the darkest corner where plenty of mosquitoes were already waiting. To make it short: we are not pleased and will never return there. We have been to Venice many times and I have a left 2 previous reviews, this is the worst place (service because of breakfast, room). I do not understand (from what we experienced) such a high rating.

Reviews.Title: “You have to go to Venice...but take lots of money!!!”
Reviews.Author: KiwisNZ2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and well serviced although it could dowith some modernisation - it is feeling and looking a bit tired. The 1 minute walk to St Marks is fantastic. We were there in winter and lots of hot water and the rooms were warm. The rooms were expensive but again, you pay for the location. Unfortunately, our room was above a restaurant and it was quite noisy - too much 3am shouting!!!! Food and wine etc is a CRAZY price. A small GLASS of beer at a restaurant was 7 Euro. The restaurants say "No service charge" as a sweetener but you have to add 12.5% tax to everything. Basically, what you budget a day in Italy...add another 50% for eating in Venice. A water taxi wanted to charge 60 Euro to get to our Hotel - no discussion. We caught the 'public transport' water taxi for 6 Euro each. But Venice makes their money from the tourists and it is a pretty cool place but perhaps a once only saty of a few days...and top up the credit card before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Good one”
Reviews.Author: dashaf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good level for Venice. Perfect location. Just a few steps from piazza San Marco. If one day you forget your camera in your room, you can easily run back and catch it - your family will still be in the queue to enter the Basilica :) Very-very convinient location. Easy to get to any vaporetto. Easy to get from the train station and easy to carry suitcases. How to find it? Find the most narrow and smelly street from piazza San Marco - here it is :) But I guess for Venice it is normal :) I personally didn't like the room stile - too old-fashioned. Again - it matches Venice right :) Beds not too comfortable. The room a bit too dark. Bathroom was ok. No view from our windows - the street was too narrow to provide any view. However I enjoyed opening the window shutters every morning to let in Venice light, noises and smells. This is what you need to experience :) Breakfest was all-right, nothing exciting. A bit too crowded, not enough space at the breakfest room. All these drawbacks are easily compensated by the very friendly staff. They will do everything for you even before you ask, as if they can read your mind :) Very happy about it. Staff is just exceptional on all levels - everything clean and tidy, they will help you with suitcases and Internet. And there was a free excursion to Murano glass Island! This was an experience! In one of those super-fast water-taxies. You can suddenly feel super-rich for 5 minutes :) Very-very enjoyable :) I personally will not stay in this hotel again, I still don't lose hope, that you can find something better in Venice. Maybe I'm wrong :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JulieNMM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few weeks ago for 2 nights. The staff was very polite and provided us with info when we needed it. The rooms were all decorated in a very old-fashioned way -- kind of how my great-grandmother's house would look! But they were fine. The bathroom was very nice and functional. The AC didn't feel as cool as I would have liked and the cleaning staff turned it off when they came in, which meant we returned to a very warm room. Our room overlooked the street but with the windows closed, there was no noise at all. With the windows open, it was noisy, but there was no need to open them at night, since there was AC. I still found it warm and requested a fan, which was brought up to me immediately. The breakfast was just fine, with eggs, breads, fruit, juices, yogurts, etc. The best thing about this hotel is the excellent location. Just steps from St. Mark's Square -- less than a minute's walk. Lots of souvenir shops and restaurants within feet of the front door. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roxyrocks84
Reviews.Content: I really have no complaints for this hotel except the beds are not long. My husband is 6'0 and his feet hung out. The hotel is in a perfect area. From the railway station it takes about 1hr and 15min to get to this area. (The water bus is way cheaper than the water taxis. We were quoted 100 euros to take us from here to the train station and it is like 12 euros on the water bus). The San Marco area is really close (there are like a million people in this area so be prepared for that). In front of the San Marco Basilica at night there are 4 restaurants that have orchestras that take turns playing songs until past 3 in the morning. You can stand and watch or if you want to sit down you have to order a drink or meal. You can walk to the Rialto Bridge and that area is actually way cheaper in foods, souvenirs and drinks. When you look at a map everything looks far but it is actually a lot closer because the streets are really like little alley ways not like streets in the States. If you want to go to the Basilica there is usually a long line all the time but go around 3pm and it is usually shorter.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but good value in a very expensive city !”
Reviews.Author: Dryhen
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming and helpful staff at the reception. Rooms clean and with just enough space. Good continental breakfast. Rather bizarre decor in part of the hotel that emulates a pair of railway carriages, complete with luggage racks ! Although not that easy to find in the maze of alleys that is Venice, it is perfectly situated as a base to explore. Venice is very expensive for Brits right now - expect to pay at least â‚¬75 for an evening meal for two with wine - but as no-one has to drive, why not have a bottle or two ?

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, Comfortable, Friendly and a great location”
Reviews.Author: John_and_Ann_Wilkins
Reviews.Content: A group of seven of us stayed here and on arrival we were impressed by the friendliness of the welcome at reception. Our rooms were ready and our bags arrived within about two minutes. Our good sized rooms were comfortable and furnished in a grand baroque style that so suits the beautiful city of Venice. Every room had a wall safe and there was no charge (nor even deposit) requested for the key. Minibar prices were surprisingly reasonable. Bathrooms were well equipped and clean. Breakfast is served in cosy surroundings and there is a small lounge with internet and TV - but who wants to lounge around in an hotel when visiting such a beautiful city? The Montecarlo is only about 100 metres from St. Mark's Basilica so is central for all major sites. Our flight home was cancelled due to volcanic ash and the airline sent us to the Best Western Cavaletto hotel - what a contrast (see separate review). After one night there we were pleased to go back to the Montecarlo - we were warmly greeted like long lost friends!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, ROMANTIC INTERIOR, KIND STUFF”
Reviews.Author: 011-family
Reviews.Content: I was preparing for this trip and choosing hotel for a long, long time. I just couldn't have chosen better hotel and better location for the money I spent, but have in mind that I paid special internet rate that was at least 30% less than usual. The location is such, that we often joked that wherever we turn, we somehow endup in our hotel. The stuff was extremely kind, esspecially the desk personel. The rooms were big having in mind that Venice rooms are small, and the interior decoration so romantic, in old Venetian style. We had a "dark blue" room and I felt like if we really went in past. The only complaint was about the breakfast - we usually went there around 9.30am and I the ladies serving were not taking out more food, so I "cought" mozzarela, tomato and porschuto just one morning. The hotel was full, but we had the immpression that the only things missing were "expensive" things, not bread and butter. If it wasn't for this, I would'n have any complaints and I am sorry that this spoils the rate of "service", because the stuff was more than great

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - Fab location”
Reviews.Author: lynz88
Reviews.Content: I can't praise this place enough for the price.. it was fantastic Location Right behind St Marks square. Pass St Marks Basilica, go under the clock tower, first right, then 3rd left. You will see a sign for the Monte Carlo. We got the Water Bus from the Airport. This was really easy to use. When you come out of the airport go left then follow the covered walkway to the marina. You can purchase a ticket here from the booth or buy one online before you go. Cost was 25 Euros return and you can get either the Red or Blue line to St Marks square. This will take about 1hr 10 mins although I believe there is a more direct line in the summer months. When you get off at St Marks square, it is just a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Hotel Really nice hotel. Finished in a typical Venetian style which was lovely. Our room was quite big. Bathroom on the small side but more than adequate for a 3 night stay. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Lots of choice. Staff were really friendly too. The only thing we missed really was a nice bar area to sit in before we went out to eat.There was a small bar tucked away in a corner but it was never maned and was covered with breakfast stuff. I guess if you really wanted a drink someone would come and served you though. This appeared to be the problem across all of Venice. It was mainly restaurants and not many bars...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sparklintan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after doing research on the abundance of hotels in Venice. I was looking for a hotel that was close to the main sights, easy to get too, and not to expensive. I was also booking 3 rooms for 6 adults, so I was looking to please everyone. We arrived very early in the morning to Venice, we found our hotel right away and although we werent able to check in right away we were able to store our luggage there and wander around for a couple hours while our rooms were cleaned. The staff was extremely helpful and easily answered all of my questions in English. The lobby of the hotel was small (as well as the elevator) but thats too be expected in Venice. There was a free breakfast every morning that most of our group took advantage off and they said it was great. Out of the three rooms, two of the three were very very small. I knew this going in and we personally didn't care as long as they were clean and comfortable. I was in room 302 and it had a full sized bed and a small window, the same as room 307. Just barely enough room for two people but we made it work. The room was very clean, the decor was pretty old though. It was cute and quaint and i'm pretty sure it was made to look that way. The bathroom on the other hand must of just been remodeled because it was very modern and very nice, even though it was small. You could not fit two people in the bathroom at one time. The shower had very good water pressure and hot water. The third room was a lot larger and had a huge full sized bathroom as opposed to the corner shower in rooms 302 and 307. My family in this room had no problems with it and enjoyed their accomodation. The only negative I have about the room is that it was like a sauna in there. The old heater was turned on and it had to have been about 90 degrees in there. Thankfully I was able to find a knob on it to manually turn it off. We could not figure out how to turn the a.c. on but when the window was open a nice breeze would come in. The bathroom did not have a fan to vent the air out so that caused excessive heat. Overall, our stay at the Montecarlo was pleasant and we all enjoyed Venice. The location was fabulous and the staff was very nice. I would recommend this hotel to other travelers who are looking to get their money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money in a superb location... cosy!”
Reviews.Author: braddeluca
Reviews.Content: Expected to be in a shoe box of a room but instead got a great clean room, a couple of floors up with a great view! good breaky for a days sight seeing... i would suggest you stay here as there are some great little shops in the immediate area and also some beautiful little restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “HARD TO BEAT FOR LOCATION, VALUE & SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: SagaloutsTour
Reviews.Content: We arrived during the Carnival, not ideal for carrying cases through small streets! However found the hotel easily, after a very long water bus ride (over an hour). Our tip don't listen to the outrageous quotes for a private water taxi, it cost 78 euros (6 people) for the water bus, we took a water taxi for 6 on the way back, only 120 euros and took less than 15 mins! The hotel has a great location, near to all the main sights, excellent breakfast, great service, very clean rooms and an ok size, ample for a holiday. There is a lot of street noise at night, as the hotel is on one of the main thoroughfares to St Marks Square, but providing you are not in bed too early, it doesn't cause sleep deprevation! Plenty of reasonably priced restaurants nearby (200m) and further afield up to (1000m) Would certainly use this hotel again. Very easy to walk to all the major sights, but if you want to go down the Grand Canal, see some of the other islands, it is worth buying a 12, 24 or 36 hour pass, as 1 trip no matter how far is 6.50 If you want to buy Murano glass, better to go to the island for choice and price

Reviews.Title: “Great choice during the Carnival!”
Reviews.Author: ElizaDoolittleADam
Reviews.Content: While visiting Venice for the annual carnival, I've chosen Hotel Montecarlo after reading reviews in TripAdvisor. It was a great hotel, with very clean and large rooms, excellent location next to Piazza San Marco, very reasonable prices and a good breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: dgrchkrt
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in this hotel after having read a lot of good reviews by other travellers.This was proved to be true.The hotel is very close to Piazza San Marco [metres away]The staff especially the receptionists are extremely polite and accomodating.We highly recommend this hotel and if you arrive late at night you can chose the Hotel Olimpia which is also a Best Western Hotel which is in Piazzale Roma that is where you are dropped if arriving by Ryanair bus or other transport means and than make your way the following morning to the Hotel MonteCarlo on foot if you are not travelling with large luggage.Well done to all at Hotel Montecarlo.We will return

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SusieB2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, small, personal, very clean, excellent value for money, with great staff, centrally situated to St Marks and surrounded by shops, restaurants, etc. Our room was lovely and spacious, the bathroom had a bath and shower - great - and more than enough piping hot water for a lovely long soak after a busy day on your feet!! Oh, and a word about the lift; it must be the smallest I've ever seen - two people side by side or end-on and your luggage - hilarious!! HELPFUL TIP - buy a Venice Connect card; I know that it just seems like yet another expense but if you buy it online beforehand the saving is significant (a 72hr pass online cost 24.75 Euros each, whereas it cost 33 Euros if you buy when you get there) - a single trip on the vaporetto is 6.5 Euros so it's well worth it, also, return bus fare (No 5) from Marco Polo is included, saving 6 Euros per person. Please note that if you want to use the Alilaguna water service to and from the airport, there's an additional charge - however, time-wise, it takes approx an hour whereas the bus takes 20 minutes! If you buy online, take the printout voucher emailed to you to the 'Venice Connect' desk which is situated just inside the main exit to the airport - look for the rainbow painted on the floor!! Venice is fabulous, the people are great and the food wonderful, but look out for the cost of drinks in the restaurants (and I'm not talking the maitre'd sort either) - soft drinks especially can be ridiculous; a large Coke/Sprite can cost 12 Euros, a small one 7.50 Euros - wine is much cheaper, nicer tasting and good for you (apparently!). Have a fabulous time - we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nick-sheff
