Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, clean, warm and friendly. Literaly 2 minutes from St Marks Basilica. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to San Marco square”
Reviews.Author: Lucybelle1
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay in Venice. It is located very close to San Marco square. The staff was extremely helpful and gave us advice regarding how to get there and the best (and cheapest) way to get back to the airport. Probably the best breakfast we had in the 4 hotels when we were in Italy. The rooms are not big but we did not spend too much time there. The bathroom had a real shower and tub. Restaurants directly adjacent to the hotel were expensive and not recommended since they are in a very touristic area. Walk a little, cross the Rialto bridge and things will be cheaper and probably better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpul staff and clean rooms. Would return.”
Reviews.Author: AlpinehornCardiff_UK
Reviews.Content: Firstly, Venice is mind-blowing. It is like being on a filmset - it's unique and a must see. Secondly, be aware of the Americans who review this hotel and say the rooms and bathrooms are small. Our room was spacious with high headroom and the bathroom was functional with room to shower, wash and sit on the loo! What else do you want to do in a bathroom?! The room was clean with quality bed linen and traditional Venetian style furniture. The hotel is superbly placed - just a one minute walk from St. Mark's Square. and 10 mins walk from the Rialto Bridge. Yes, it's situated on a VERY narrow street but hey, Mr American, this is Venice and big is not always beautiful! The hotel staff was knowledgeable and helpful and breakfast was plentiful. Being in the middle of the tourist area meant the room was a little noisy with people sounds, but of course, no traffic noise and closing the external shutters as well as the windows cut out most of this. However, it quietened down well before midnight as most tourists bedded down early for the next day's busy sightseeing. Some tips: 1. Avoid Venice in the hot summer months. It's very crowded and the nature of the place does give rise to nasty drainage smells - so they say. We visited in October (our first visit) and the weather was fab. 20 degrees and bright blue skies - and mo smells! 2. Don't be frightened by the absence of vehicular access when finding your hotel. Of course, there are no buses and taxis on the island but getting around is easy. Do your research first and look at the public transport system online to find out how it all works. There are regular water buses which connect with the hire car, rail and bus stations at Piazzale Roma and everyone is helpful and will advise you how to buy your ticket and what line you need to take. Yes, you will have to walk from the waterbus stop through some streets to your hotel, and the streets can be difficult to navigate as they are busy and narrow, so it's easy to lose your sense of direction, but just pop in a shop or bar to ask directions. 3 Consider buying a waterbus multi day pass. The single journey is expensive at â‚¬6.50 but if you want to use these buses a lot, a 2 day pass is â‚¬28 and includes the lines that go out to the other islands. The water buses are not always quicker than walking but it can take 20 mins to walk from one side of the Grand Canal to the other, as there are very few bridges, whereas you can cross in 2 mins on a water bus. 4 Restaurants can be expensive but you can also find many reasonably priced pasta and pizza places and there are countless bars and street-food outlets. You can find tourist menus for as little as â‚¬14 or pasta and pizza for under â‚¬10. 5 Ask the hotel about the free water taxi ride to the Murano Glass Factory. The factory provides free water taxis and so you can use these to see a little of Venice from the water. It's not a proper water tour like the hotel describes, and be prepared for a hard sell from the glass salesman who will personally escort you around the glass factory. The glass products are amazing but very expensive - their largest chandelier costing â‚¬40,000! However, the small jewelry items are OK, starting at â‚¬40, and you don't have to buy anything. At the end of the visit they provide a taxi back to the mainland but not neccesarily to the same place they picked you up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hein_Ria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to St Mark square and early morning and late night walks without the crowds are just the best! The hotel staff where very friendly and helpful in English. Obviously the rooms and bathrooms are small, but hey, you only sleep there! (ok also wash). The small window on the first floor room was just enough and looked down on the little alley in fron of the hotel. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, small hotel, exellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pinja
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon in this hotel and I sent an e-mail to make sure that weÂ´ll get a nice room. Well we got the smallest room in that hotel and the view was backyard and another buildings wall. I donÂ´t really know why this happened. I looked for the room map and saw that our room was the smallest. I also wanted to have a bath but there was a shower. Toilet was very small. I wonder how a 100kg man can use that... The resepsionists were friendly and helpfull answering all questions. Breakfast was okay. The location is really exellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, Great value for money (for Venice)”
Reviews.Author: kevinw1957
Reviews.Content: Just a short walk from St Mark's Square, this is a perfectly adequate hotel for a few nights. We arrived off a cruise ship and reached the hotel at about noon, expecting to have to store our baggage while we went elsewhere to wait for our room. Instead, it was ready for us and we immediately got the impression that this was going to be a good stay. The front desk staff are extremely helpful - assistance with our bagge was offerred immediately and we were given guide books on Venice. Our room was on the first floor (non-smoking), at the rear of the building. There is no view from the hotel due to its location. Room was decorated in traditional Venitian style - a little tired in places, perhaps, but all totally functional and comfortable. Everything worked as it should, but the fan on the aircon was a little noisy. The staff were all exceptionaly friendly, greating us with a "bongiorno" on every occassion. Most spoke perfect English as well. Beds were comfortable and the room was quite at night. The bathroom was fine; the water was hot, although it took a while to run through to get hot - but OK eventually. Breakfast is a buffet, constantly refreshed. The breakfast room is a bit small, but it looked as though they were also using the restauant next door (connecting doors). It wasn;t particularly cheap to stay - around Â£350 for 2 nights B&B, but nothing in Venice is cheap. Considering the location and the quality of service and especially comparing proices in the same area, we were content with what we'd paid. Certainly, if going back to Venice, this is somewhere we would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DarylOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montecarlo Hotel for 7 nights in August and would highly recommend the hotel. Our air conditioned room was large, very clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was large, modern and kept immaculate by the maids. The included breakfast was ample - scrambled eggs, tomatoes, sausages (ie hotdogs), cheeses, breads, cereals, fruit and juices; coffee, tea or hot chocolate. The desk staff were very accommodating, knowledgeable, friendly and spoke very good English as well as several other languages. It's very central and easy to find, being about 2 minutes from San Marco. We found the hotel quiet at night despite a lot of foot traffic on the calle. The addition of free wifi would be a great asset; internet in the lobby is quite expensive (5 euros for 30 minutes). We would definitely return to the Montecarlo on any future trips to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great service”
Reviews.Author: meandyou15
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights here using Tripadvisor reviews to help us choose. Really good location, big choice at breakfast which is very important for us! The hotel and our room was spotlessly clean. Not a huge room but perfectly good for 3 nights and very comfortable and cool. All the staff were lovely. Not bad price for high season Venice close to Piazza San Marco. (Â£105 per night ) Great for walking around Piazza later at night or early morning before crowds.Just 2 mins away. Easy to find, we thought, down a tiny alleyway near a Macdonald's! View from window was just rooftops and back alleys but that was not important. Heard bells from Piazza at 7am....fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ArtLover4545
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great in terms of its location; it is literally a 30 second walk to San Marcos Square, and a 2 minute walk to the water bus (vaparetto) stop. The hotel staff is very friendly and accomodating. Like most Italian hotels there is no iron in the room, which can get kind of annoying when you're traveling for a week and living out of a suitcase and you don't want to wear wrinkled clothes. But other than that, a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: GyanBaba
Reviews.Content: Ideal location and good breakfast but rooms are not as comfortable as expected a three star hotel to be.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: localgirl21
Reviews.Content: The montecarlo was perfect for our three nights in Venice. We got the watertaxi from the train station to st marco stop on the water taxi's, once you are in st marks square its fairly easy to find, its one minute walk from the square. If you havnt been to Venice before I would recommend it on this alone. If you book a hotel up a little alleyway somewhere it will be extremely difficult to find. venice streets are quite small and confusing. The reception spoke good english and were very helpful. the room was cute and decorated in the traditional venitian style, very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was the nicest one out of all the bathrooms i had in 6 different hotels over italy. a bit more spacious than others and very clean and modern. breakfast was pretty decent. cant find a bad thing to say about it. you should stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Room very, very small......”
Reviews.Author: TwoYearTour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, but the room we had was extremely small. The staff was helpful, but I would not stay here for more than 2 nights maximum. We were only in our room for a few hours at night, but the beds are not comfortable and I repeat the room is TINY... Venice is great.... Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, beware free Murano trip.”
Reviews.Author: ADemaio12
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was in a great location, with a view of San Marco from the fourth floor. The building is very typical of Venice, with uneven rooms and hallways that suggest that the building is really settling into the lagoon. The staff was very helpful and courteous with a good handle on English and French (perhaps other foreign languages as well). Breakfast was tasty and very appreciated fuel for our busy days. Beware the "free" water taxi to Murano. This is the island famous for its hand-blown glass. It is not cheap to take a private water taxi there, but the hotel provides a complementary service. However, it is actually provided by the Signoretti glass factory, which is happy to ferry tourists over to the island, give them a brief tour, and then desperately push them into buying one of their overpriced pieces before ferrying them right back to Venice before they can see another factory. One tourist bought a beautiful ring there but was crestfallen when it broke the very next day. To make matters worse, Signoretti refused to replace it, after touting the strength and durability of their jewelry.

Reviews.Title: “the room was slightly larger than a shoe box, smallest room we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Kostos
Reviews.Content: The staff were delightful, the location was excellent (not on a canal) but the rooms were so tiny!

Reviews.Title: “If its Venice, it has to be the MonteCarlo”
Reviews.Author: Minnesotaactor
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed two nights at the MonteCarlo in Venice. A wonderful experience in every way. Our room was immaculate, well appointed, and everything worked. The location is the most central in Venice for either walking or taking a water bus to any attraction. The breakfast every morning is a feast! Front desk staff are the best......any and all questions and concerns are taken care of immediately and with great care. We would not think of staying anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: travelcat26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. It is just off of Piazza San Marco, and is surrounded by shopping. I loved Venice, and I will stay here again if I get the chance to go back. The staff was very friendly, and there was a nice breakfast every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Lilla_Lotta
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (can be easily reached from St. Marco water bus station), friendly and helpful staff who speak fluent English. Our room was of a good size with a minibar and a safe. Good breakfast and the tables are cleaned quickly. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, expensive”
Reviews.Author: aybc
Reviews.Content: This small 50 room hotel is in one of the best locations in Venice, Italy. It is one block from San Marco Square near everything. It is hard to find the first time. Print and bring a detailed map as it is on an allyway. Rooms were VERY small for 250 euros a night, but think "one block off Times Square in New York" as a comparison. The location is worth the price. Bathrooms small and old---really need a remodel. Staff was EXCELLENT. All speak perfect english and dont have Italian "attitude". Familys probably want to look elsewhere, but singles and couples should consider. Breakfast included and was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short break, if you don't mind small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bobjob21
Reviews.Content: For an off-season short break to see the main sights of Venice this hotel was perfect. The location is its selling point - 100 yds from the Piazza San Marco. But the staff were also excellent - much better than I have found in a hundred business travel hotels in the UK. No evening restaurant but there are many many restaurants within a few minutes walk at all prices. Breakfasts were very good, well up to large hotel standards and the small breakfast room promoted interaction with the other English-speaking guests (most of them). The only drawback was the small size of the double room - don't try swinging any cats! Ok for a romantic weekend, but a bit awkward when our clothes got soaked in a rainstorm: no way to dry them and get in and out of the room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but watch out for air conditioning leaks and say no to the tours!”
Reviews.Author: bigliljen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Montecarlo was easy to find, right off the San Marco square, and conveniently located. Hotel staff was friendly, and all spoke fluent English. The elevator is quite small, and slow however. Luckily we were on the 1st floor and could take the stairs and not have to wait each day. The room was very nice, as was the bathroom with lots of hot water. Had a Mini bar but could not find a safe in the room. Shutters over the windows blocked out noise and light, so sleep was comfortable. However, we awoke in the middle of the night to our bathroom floor being wet (not good in the middle of the night on marble), and found a leak coming from our bathroom door frame. We went down and spoke to the front desk, who we had to wake up, and who was not very pleasant. He stated it was from the air conditoining, and he would turn it off and it would stop. Sure enough it did eventually stop leaking, but we had to use the garbage can and all our towels to soak it up. The next morning, the front desk was very helpful and apologetic and allowed us extra time in the room if we needed it, even though we were checking out that day, but it was promptly fixed. Breakfast was very good, with choice of great scrambled eggs, breads and fruit. Located in the heart of shopping, it was great. Be aware of the Murano tours...and decline if asked. The hotel attempts to recruit tourists for the tour, and once you're there, it is nothing but pressure selling! Otherwise a very nice place to stay and nicely priced.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional”
Reviews.Author: george4209
Reviews.Content: this superbly located hotel exceeded all expectations. The staff was helpful,room spacious and the breakfast was delightful. The wait staff at breakfast were warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “best location with incredible service”
Reviews.Author: laxfamily7
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Montecarlo in April 2009. The staff could not have been nicer- they spoke English well, they were informative about the area, and they always greeted us with a smile. The rooms were spacious and clean- the location was perfect. The hotel is a block from San Marco square and in the middle of some wonderful shopping areas. They even gave us a free tour of the Murano glass factory- the water taxi picked us up and dropped us off...the views were splendid. If you are going to Venice, this hotel cannot be beat for the money. I based my selection according to the reviews and am very glad I did....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, friendly staff, fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: Christine033
Reviews.Content: We have just returned having spent three nights at this Hotel and we can't praise it enough. Next to St Marks Square, rooms not as small as you usually experience in Italy.The Hotel is absolutely spotless. Breakfast is taken in the welcoming dining room, there is a good choice of food. Just next to the Hotel is a large selection of shops and restaurants. It was easy to find just leave St Marks by going through the arch under the Torre dell'Orologio [clock] turn first right and look for the Hotel sign on the street corner.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: stevemNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed for three nights over the Easter weekend at the Montecarlo. It was my second stay and the hotel has been refurbished since my first visit but the service is exactly the same - excellent. From the moment you walk through the door you are greeted with genuine hospitality and it is a real pleasure to stay at this hotel. As someone who has stopped in the majority of chain hotels on both business and leisure I can honestly say the Montecarlo has a very personal touch which we found really endearing. In terms of location it is really good being just behind St Mark's square so 5-10 minutes walk from the Alilaguna ferry stop from Marco Polo airport. The hotel does a good continental breakfast which we found fine and the hotel also has it's own restaurant for evening dining. All in all a very pleasant stay but a couple of tips on Venice in general

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Taffy45
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the hotel and the room size and quality of breakfast were a big surpise. Staff were very friendly, welcoming and extremly helpful. the location was one block behind St Marks Square. The rooms were very comfortable and had lots of storage, plenty of hot water, lovely king size bed and excellent heating For value for money you will be hard to beat this gem of a hotel and if I visit Venice again I will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: wildonesminn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3 nights during the first week of Feb. There were 4 couples in 4 rooms. Positives include spacious rooms for Europe, full baths w/bidet, turn down service, excellent breakfast buffet included, coffee not included though. Windows open and also have locking shutters which are welcome as the neighboring building is close enough to reach out and touch. The staff was always cheerful, very helpful, most spoke very good English, The hotel is in an old building but the condition was very good. No complaints here. Don't expect any amenities such as restaurant, spa, pool, or sauna. They do serve very good coffee and possibly drinks most anytime. The building is surrounded closely on all sides so there is no view. Location is perfect, not on a busy sidewalk so rooms were quiet for good sleeping. Also wasn't too hard to find once you realize that street naming makes no sense at all. You walk down one block and the street name changes for no discernible reason. And by "street", some are no more than 4 feet wide and most less than 12 feet wide. We would definitely go to the Monte Carlo again. We had a marvelous time in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Not room 212”
Reviews.Author: AJMBournemouth
Reviews.Content: The hotel took a bit of finding and the water bus numbers all changed very recently. First impressions were great. A warm welcome from the staff . Everywhere was very clean and in good condition. Our room was small but had flat screen tv, minibar, safe and was warm. However our shower room (NO BATH) was very small and the shower tray in the corner only had a shower curtain not a glass surround. If they had planned it better, there would have been room for a short bath with stand up shower at one end. It would have been so good to have had a relaxing soak in the bath after a busy day sightseeing. The shower room was however very clean. Buffet breakfast was fine for a 3* hotel; with two hot dishes, cereals, yoghurts, juices, cold ham & chesse and breads. The buffet was constantly replenished by the friendly staff. Location is great for St Marks Sq and most other places. The bells are a bit noisey at 0700 in the morning. Would I stay there again ?? Yes but only if the room had a bath. Check Check Check .

Reviews.Title: “Location was great”
Reviews.Author: BrendaGBaker
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for 6 days and stayed at the Hotel Monte Carlo the entire time. We changed rooms after the 1st night. We were on the third floor on the front of the hotel. There was street noise and bell ringing, windows were blocked by the construction, and the room was too warm. The front desk was very accommodating and moved us to a room on the 4th floor at the end of the hall with more windows, larger bathroom, and very quiet. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was fine, scrambled eggs and the normal European fare. Flooding most days, but the hotel location allowed us options. Very close to St. Marks, good restaurants, shopping, museums, and the Rialto bridge and market. I also highly (!!) recommend a restaurant that is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We ate lunch there the first day and then dinner again the last night and it was by far the best food we had all week! It is the Ristorante Ai Due Vescovi at Sestiere di San Marco, 81. First lunch I had was a pesto stuffed spinach ravioli with pumpkin creme and my husband had fish soup that was just incredible, flavorful and loaded with seafood. He ordered the same soup 2 other places and there was no comparison. The food is reasonably priced and everything we had was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: wenrob
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Italy, booking our hotels in Venice and Florence based on Trip Adivsor ratings and comments. We were quite satisfied with this Venice hotel. It is in a great location, within a 5 minute walk to the Rialto bridge one way, and to St. Mark's square the other way. The room was comfortable (particularly the beds), the staff upgraded our room for the second night because the hotel wasn't full, and the breakfast was great (included hot foods, which is not standard at many European hotels). We happened to be there on Dec. 1/08 when Venice had the highest flood waters in 30 years. The calm, efficient hotel staff went above and beyond to call the nerves of frazzled tourists. If we went again during flood season, I'd likely stay north of the Grand Canal in order to be sure we could get to the train station easily. Other than during flood season, this hotel is perfectly situated. All my research about Venice mentioned how difficult it is to get around (which is true). It's like one gigantic maze. To be sure we could find the hotel after a tiring day of travel, I printed out directions from Mapquest as well as from the hotel's website, which helped tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Pamhain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Dec 07, the guy at receptionist was less than helpful and quite rude in all dealings we had with the one guy in particular, we booked their best rooms and it did not live up to expectations, it was small and there was a smell of paint for the 3 days we were there too. We "splashed out" on this hotel and we were so let down by it! The food was only "OK" too, it wasn't anything to write home about. Most mornings we were woken early (6am) by locals outside. In saying all that, the location was very central, just off St Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Dominic007
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Monte Carlo hotel, having stayed two nights there. The hotel staff are all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a delightful old building, tastefully renovated. Despite being in a busy location, our room on the fourth floor was very quiet and peaceful. The room was clean, warm and comfortable, with everything we needed, and everything worked as it should. The bathroom was excellent, stylish and with copious hot water and a powerful shower in addition to the bath. The breakfast buffet was excellent, with a good range of everything we wanted in addition to superb coffee. The location of the hotel was superb, within a short walk from Piazza San Marco. We chose to arrive by water taxi, which is an extra expense but we felt that it was worth the cost and we arrived within 50 metres of the hotel. The hotel is however very easy to find from San Marco if you choose to arrive via the water buses, with the directions "through the arch under the clock, first right, and second left [just after McDonalds]" and it's signed also. Venice is a joy to explore, and getting lost whilst exploring is fun. The designer shops are everywhere, and Rialto and the market are good to see, even if you're not spending. Getting back to the hotel is simplicity itself; simply follow the signs to San Marco on buildings everywhere, and retrace your steps from the clock. San Marco basilica is a must, as is the museum inside. It is very much worth the climb up the steep staircase! Do not worry about visiting Venice in November; it is still beautiful, even if it rains. The galleries and museums are not just 'havens out of the rain'; they are very much worth a visit in their own right. Venice is already calling me back!

Reviews.Title: “Central and good value”
Reviews.Author: crissietoff
Reviews.Content: Right next to St Marks Square and easy for getting around the city. The room wasn't large but was adequate for what we needed which was just somewhere to sleep and have breakfast. The staff were all polite and helpful. Breakfast adequate. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel that is central and good value for money then this is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJTA
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Venice, we were a bit worried about finding the hotel. Several descriptions that we found (some contradictory!) of the location of the Monte Carlo DID ultimately help us. Dragging your bags across Piazza San Marco will most likely be your introduction to Venice - not a great experience, but once you find the Monte Carlo on the tiniest of street, surrounded by wonderful restaurants and shops, you will enter a friendly home-from-home. Every person we spoke to at the front desk had perfect English, a good sense of humor, and a great deal of information about Venice. Restaurant recommendations were perfectly tuned to our requests for price, budget, ambience. Our room was simple, small, low-ceilinged, and perfectly adequate. A/C worked and our view over the rooftops was spectacular. The hotel offered a free trip to a glass factory/shop on Murano and we took them up on it - we were captives in the glass shop for a while, but then managed to snag a free ride to Burano where we were again captives for a short time (in a very interesting lace shop this time). We were then freed on Burano, where we had a wonderful lunch and walk around this "miniature Venice". The location of this hotel could not be better - you can explore the magic of Venice in every direction!

Reviews.Title: “A Find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bellagio30514
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Montecarlo was wonderful. The location was excellent- the hotel is literally two minutes away from St. Mark's Square. The hotel was also easy to find. The hotel room was clean and very quaint, Venetian style. The hotel staff was wonderful- they were very friendly and extremely helpful (particularly with gondola/tour questions and travel questions). The hotel breakfast was great. It had much variety and great coffee/tea service. It also had a free taxi to the island of Murano where we saw a demonstration of how the glass is hand-made. Very cool. All hotels, including this hotel, in Venice are pricy, but we did NOT consider this hotel to be overpriced or overrated. In fact, we feel this hotel was a FIND in Venice- we had a wonderful stay and we would stay here again. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to a friend. NOTE: We would recommend going to the top of the bell tower to view the island and to look over St. Mark's square. It was probably one of the most beautiful attractions we saw in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jaxsilver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. Situated right between Rialto and San Marco ferry stops. Lots to see around the area. Very clean hotel and comfy beds - but small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. AC leaves much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: A_Globe_Trotter
Reviews.Content: GREAT: One can hardly beat the location, it is a few steps off San Marco Piazza. GOOD: Breakfast was good, staff was nice. The room was not very big, nevertheless it was comfortable. NOT-SO-GOOD: Internet is pricy: 5 euros ($8) for half an hour. Of course, one doesn't go to Venice to spend time on the computer, so it may or may not be a problem. Also, make sure you find out where is the hotel BEFORE you get there. Hotel is in a small street that can be tricky to find. BAD: Air conditioning was not working so well, we even had a failure for a day (didn't sleep much that night).

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cloverny
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal around Europe and am not someone how gets bothered by little things but this hotel was the worst I have stayed in. I would not recommend it to anyone. First, the room was dirty when I entered it, housekeeping had not cleaned it yet from the people who stayed there prior to us. After calling the front desk to let them know this, they did not put me in new room, they told me, rather rudely, I would have to wait for the room to be cleaned. Considering I was only staying in Venice for the weekend, this was a bit of an inconvenience for me but one I was able to deal with, like I said, it takes alot to bother me. Once I did get my hotel room cleaned and was settled, the room was loud from the street below which made it very dificult to sleep. The walls were as thin as tissue paper so I could hear EVERYTHING going on in the adjacent rooms. When I mentioned this to the manager downstairs, they stated there was ntothing they could do to help me and they were very rude about it. I have never been treated so rudely and I approached them nicely and discussed it like a calm person, their response to me was extremely unneccessary. There are numerous other reasons why I would not recommend this hotel to friends and family. The bed was thin, like a pull out couch, with springs coming out into your back while you tried to sleep, the room was dark and dingy, the noise from the street made it impossible to sleep. This is my first bad review of a hotel on this site but I really thought this hotel stay was one of my worst.

Reviews.Title: “Marco and Erasmus - You Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: MandMIdaho
Reviews.Content: We stayed only at 5-Star hotels in Roma and Firenze - but decided to "go cheaper" in Venezia because everything is so expensive there. So we checked "Tripadvisor" and found this hotel - the Montecarlo. We read the reviews - and decided to book for three nights. Well - all I can say is - believe everything you've read. The staff - especially Marco (what a sweetie!) and Erasmus (what a crack up!) will not rest until you feel at home. Marco helped me practice my Italian and made two room changes for us without charge!! Erasmus took the time to get to know us - and convinced us we just HAD to go to San Marco's square after dark - which we did and had a magical and romantic time! As I said to Marco upon our departure - all of the people working at the 5-star hotels at which we stayed were "POLITE" - the staff at Montecarlo were FRIENDLY!! (I don't know what they earn - but they all deserve a RAISE!!)

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal and Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RogersCS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montecarlo for three nights prior to our cruise. This has to be one of the best deals in Venice. The location was perfect for St. Mark's Square, Rialto Bridge, market area, etc. Our room was on the streetside, king size bed, room and bathroom spacious and very clean. The breakfast buffet was more than enough, staff very friendly and helpful. We printed online directions to take the Alilaguna Line to St. Mark's from the airport and also the directions for this hotel from a previous review and had no problems. [Pack light because you will be hauling your own suitcase[s] to and from, on and off the waterbus [vaporetti] or water taxi and up, over and down bridges!] We took tours of the Secret Room of the Doges Palace, Hidden Venice and the Grand Canal tour. This gave us a great overview and also left us time to sightsee on our own; the Basilica [be sure to go upstairs], academia, Jewish Ghetto, Burano, etc. Get a pass for the vaporettos [we got a 3-day pass] and sometimes just took the long way around to see sights as well as walk, walk, walk. Buy a good map [Streetwise is a good one] with all the streets. [The street names are up high on the corners of the buildings.]

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Quality and Cost”
Reviews.Author: Psmith2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and were very impressed with the Hotel's excellent balance of location, quality and cost. LOCATION. It is approx 75m from St Marks Square en route to the Rialto so we could not have asked for a more convenient site. It was very handy to pop back for a rest, siesta or to pick up rain coats etc. We were at the back of the hotel on the third floor and were not bothered by noise at any time during our stay. I cannot vouch for the front of the hotel which is on a busy walkway. QUALITY. I found the overall quality to be of a high standard. The dÃ©cor is becoming a little tired, but certainly not shabby. The rooms are compact by modern new build standards but we had a large double bed (kingsize) and plenty of space to move around the room even with our baggage and clothes in place. The bathroom was relatively new, had a short bath and a powerful shower. Everything was immaculately clean. The staff were very polite and went out of their way to be helpful. Breakfast was basic but had a reasonable selection (we did not go hungry!). VALUE FOR MONEY. The low cost clinched the deal and would secure my return and recommendation. Whilst you can find hotels where the breakfasts are better, rooms bigger and dÃ©cor more recent I believe that you will pay MUCH more. TIP â€“ to keep costs down use the mini supermarket 200m away. Turn right out of the hotel, 50m turn right again under a square old lamp, 100m (over a bridge), turn left at the Ratti hardware store, shop is 50m on right. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BigJimH
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel befitting the Best Western name. Property is in a sweet location, just off St Marks square (through clock tower, take first right, then left just past McDonald's). I arrived late in the afternoon and the clerk (Massimo) was most helpful directing me to a great cafe just down the way. I requested an extra night, and he accomodated without having me move, even though I know they were busy. I honestly can't say enough about the staff...they seemed genuinely eager to help. They even arranged a free boat trip to Murano (glass) for interested guests. As with the entire hotel, the room was clean, a little cramped, but there was ample storage, and the bed was comfortable. Bathroom was quite large with tile floors, and good water pressure. Great breakfast (eggs, sausages, sliced meats and cheese, croissants, fruit, yogurt, juices, great coffee and more...). Not much of a view. My room was on the front side, windows looked out at rooftops of adjacent buildings. Being so close to the square, you get to experience the tower bells each hour. I personally had no problem with it, but just fyi for those who sleep light. Wi-Fi access is insanely expensive, but so it goes everywhere now. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jkjkjkjk
Reviews.Content: We found the Montecarlo just right for our needs. The standard rooms were small but very clean with plenty of storage space,the mini bar was reasonable by Venice standards. The breakfast spread was good and set us up nicely for the day. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The restaurant on the left as you leave the hotel was wonderful (though very expensive). Finaly the location couldn't be better. In conclusion, for the price I don't think the Montecarlo can be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: MySFBay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in May of 2007 for a part of our honeymoon. It's a great property, easily accessible to public transportation and the major tourist sites. It seems silly to say it 'felt' like we were in Venice staying at this hotel (duh!), but really, it felt like we were in Venice! PROS: - Location! You will have no trouble hitting the major tourist sites from this hotel - Clean room, newly renovated bathroom - Friendly staff, spoke fluent english. - Very good breakfast - you may opt not to buy the breakfast since the hotel is sooo close to restaurants, but it was worth the price for my husband and I. - Safe area! CONS: - The bed in our room was a double, which was fine, but it sloped in the middle. Not comfortable. My back ached. - The room decor: if you are expecting a room with updated furnishings, this is not the hotel for you. - Maybe for some: proximity to major tourist sites - they are literally around the corner! I would highly recommend staying at this hotel for it's convenience, affordability and location. We would stay here again (but request a different bed!).

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value in an Overpriced City”
Reviews.Author: emilee_leblanc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Montecarlo is, as other people have described, very near St. Mark's Square. It is down a little side alley (a recent reviewer gave excellent directions--print them out and take them with you). The front desk staff is efficient and the rooms and public spaces are very clean. We had a "standard" room and found it to be more than adequate; it did not seem small by European standards. Breakfast is good with lots of variety. I did wonder why they served such dismal bread . . . but I saw lots of bad bread in Venice. Go figure. The hotel is in a handy location but the location does not feel restful and is not particularly charming. If you want an old hotel feeling and quiet, quaint surroundings, go elsewhere. I would recommend eating in another area of the city. We found a small place--Osteria Alberto in Canareggio--that was inexpensive, interesting, and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dicorrs
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask to be better located. Some expansion on directions offered by others would be helpful though. If coming from Piazzale Roma, take the #82 Vaparetto to S. Zacchia. When you get off, turn left toward the clock tower (it's in St Mark's Square). When you get to the square, turn right and follow it to the two stone lions. Turn left into the alley (next to the Pauly Glass store). You'll see signs from there for the hotel. As for the hotel...the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was small but if you've traveled as extensively as we have in Europe, you won't be surprised. The only problem we had was with the radiator. We could not turn it off and had to sleep with the window open so we could breathe. The noise from the church bells kept us up all night. BUT if you can turn the radiator off and leave the shutters closed, the church is not a problem. From the front of the hotel there are tons of shops and lots of restaurants (including McDonald's). If you were so inclined, you could stay close by and see a lot. I wasn't very impressed with the Rialto Bridge but there is some good shopping there. The Vaparettos are so easy to use (we bought two day passes at the airport) and are well marked. The trip to Murano was pretty but I didn't find Murano all that interesting (maybe because it was December). I can imagine it's a bit more lively in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Lady_PWarwick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Hotel Montecarlo largely because of the location. Within a couple of meanders from St. Marks Square, you do not have very far to travel to be in the heart of it all. Also, as we realised if you are arriving at night and havn't quite got your Venice bearings, you can get to your hotel after a couple of twists and turns and without dragging your bag up steps and across bridges! The room was small but adequate. As the hotel guide says 'recently refurbished in Venetican style' does mean that you get greeted by gold edged swirly wardrobes, and patterned wallpaper and bedspread which is not the image an English visitor associates with a 'refurbished hotel' but as you soon realise this is the way the Veneticians do things and you have to go with it! Added bonus of mini bar and Tv with Sky News in room, as well as view of Basilica out of the window. Breakfast is adequate, and as you soon realise as you eat around Venice, you will be charged a lot for very little if you opt to drink your coffee sitting down and have your sandwich brought to your table! Breakfast is the same each day: juices. fresh fruit, yoghurt, bread, croissant, spreads, basic pink ham, frankfurter and a rich scrambled egg. For the dairy intollerent it is a bit ham-dominant but the coffee is good and the service friendly.All in all, good place to lay your head, all staff offer as much information as you ask for, and makes for a very good value off-season stay.

Reviews.Title: “Venice in August”
Reviews.Author: D Bus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of August and had a good room, 201 that overlooked the laneway (see picture). The furniture was lovely with hand painted flowers. The room is small (13x13) but adequate for the two of us. We had no problem with the bathroom which had everthing a 3* should have. It was clean and everything worked! The breakfast room is smaller than most but we never had to wait. The coffee and hot chococlate were served promptly and there was plenty of food. We enjoyed the fresh fruit and the sweet buns. The decor of the breakfast room is quite classy. We were there for 4 nights and enjoyed it. The AC was very quite! The desk staff were very good and efficient always ready to help. Tip - I f you are staying for a few days, get a VeniceCard at the airport (check it out on internet). By staying at this hotel we were able to see everything we wanted plus more in a relaxed manner. We ate near the hotel (thanks for tip re yellow tablecloths) and found the food OK . Prices were fine as there are several places and the competition is keeping the prices reasonable. Tip - Don't bring more than one bag. We used one backpack! Although the ground from St. Mark's Square to the Hotel is flat with no bridges we saw others struggling with their bags. Tip - Best photo from San Giorgio"s Belltower (see picture). Using our Venice Card we took several side trips especially in the evenings on the vaporettos. The best one was to the island of Lido (see picture).

Reviews.Title: “Good location but Janky old hotel WORST BATHROOMS EVER!”
Reviews.Author: jezzica23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a small alley like most in Venice and close walking distance to San Marco Square. If you take the waterbus, get off on the Stop after San Marco. The walking distance is much closer as the square is huge. Take the 82 if you can b/c the 1 is super slow. This hotel was pretty old and gross. This was the worst hotel we stayed at for our 2 week Euro trip. The bathrooms were the worst I've ever seen. The shower had a gross old curtain the kept sticking to your body and the shower pan would not hold the water. After a shower, our entire bathroom would be flooded for the entire day. Our room was as small as a closet and the view looked into another building. The only thing good about this hotel was their breakfast! I would not recommend this hotel as it is more like a 2 star or 1.5 star versus the 3 stars that they advertise. We paid about 140 a night booking straight from www.bestwestern.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff at the Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: jh5546
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel and loved it. The room was clean and had windows overlooking the front 'street'. It was quiet and very close to St. Mark's square. Breakfast was a nice buffet, nothing fancy, but quite adequate. The staff at the desk was charming and always helpful. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “The Best In Venice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Livewithpassion
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in Venice in San Marco. Yes the rooms are very small but nicely decorated and very clean, with venetian glass.The buffet breakfast is 7-10 am and the room that it is served in is small so get there early. besides it is a good idea to get up early to beat the crowds in Venice. The buffet has cold cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, scramble eggs, toast, and sausage.The staff is the best I have ever seen!!! They are so pleasant and helpful. My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. Our luggage was lost and they were calling Alitalia for us to find out the status of our luggage. When it was found they placed it inside our room.They are great with directions as it is crazy to find things in Venice-but that is half the fun!!! They even made us coffee 4:30 am before we left to get our water taxi to the airport. If you are in Venice this hotel is a must. I talked to people that were staying at high end hotels and ours was so much better!!! they said next time they would stay at the Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “Tkry somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: EDHJIM
Reviews.Content: If you're claustrophobic, stay elsewhere. Located on narrow pathway, small lobby, miniscule elevator, small room and bathroom. Staff and buffet breakfast were fantastic. Located spitting distance from St Mark's, but there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Location, Nice Clean, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mary_lavelle
Reviews.Content: This is a small but perfectly adequate, clean, friendly hotel about three minutes walk from St Marks Square. Had no problems with air conditioning. Stayed on the 2nd Floor.Continental Breakfast was good with range of cereal, fruit, breads, pastries, ham and cheese and there's scrambled eggs and bacon! I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a find!”
Reviews.Author: Lawyerjk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel; what a find it turned out to be. We thought that the standard of the room we had and the hotel generally was excellent for the price which we paid bearing in mind how close it is to St Mark's Square and all of the other major attractions. The rooms were kept spotlessly clean and bedding and towels were changed each day and it's one of the few hotels which we've stayed in where we could bear to leave the air conditioning on all night as normally the noise is horrible but this one was almost silent. And we did need it as the weather was so humid. It really is a 2 or 3 minute walk to St Mark's which is particularly good in the evening when you feel that you've walked enough during the day and only want a short stroll to find a good restaurant of which there are many in the area. We would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: emmajSouthampton
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself was clean, comfortable and near the sites. However, we booked a kongsize room through the hotels own website and were given a very small doubble room which the hotel staff refused to change which did put a bit of damer on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the so called free Grand Canal Tour”
Reviews.Author: meridian2003
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival at the BW Montecarlo, my daughter and I inquired about booking a "Grand Canal" tour from a tour agency. A receptionist told us that BW would have a free "Grand Canal" tour for BW customers the next day and specifically instructed me not to go to a tour agency. We were overjoyed and rearranged our itinerary so we could take advantage of this offer. However, rather than a tour of the canals, the next day we were directly taken to a glass factory on the Morano Island. Ultimately we even had to pay our own fare back to San Marco. It was a total sham.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Shefford
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for first-time visitors to Venice, as it is very near Piazza San Marco and the Doges Palace, and convenient for water buses to all parts of the city and lagoon. It's not far to the Rialto Bridge, either. Our room and bathroom were clean and comfortable, and there was a reasonable choice in the breakfast buffet. The staff all spoke English, although they appreciated my attempts at Italian, and they were all very friendly and helpful. There is internet access for guests, but it's not cheap at EUR5 for 30 minutes. The downside of staying so near Piazza San Marco is that the nearby restaurants tend to be expensive, or have unimpressive "Tourist Menus". By walking for ten minutes or so towards the Castello area of the city, it is possible to find better-value restaurants, where the locals eat. It's also good to get away from the crowds around San Marco, and experience the quieter side of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Functioning and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: BettyMontreal
Reviews.Content: Great location. We were there last week of March 2007. We were on the top floor (4) so looked our over neighbouring roof tops and had a view of St, Marks and the Campanile. Staff were all Italian and spoke English and were totally helpful. Our room could have used some refurbishing but the bathroom was clean and huge by Italian standards.

Reviews.Title: “It lived up to expectations.....”
Reviews.Author: bickley
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the reviews it receives on tripadvisor.com. (On my last visit to Venice I stayed at another Best Western hotel, the Hotel Ala, which I quite enjoyed but on tripadvisor the reviews of the Ala are not unanimously favourable and I have the impression that it rather depends on which room you get. Everybody who reviews the Montecarlo seems to like it.) The hotel was rather difficult to find (it is in a very narrow 'street' very close to St Marks. The staff were welcoming and efficient. Our room (even if I didn't like the style which was very ornate) was comfortable and immaculately clean. I would certainly consider staying here again when I next visit Venice. There is a restaurant adjacent, the Antico Pignolo, which has a separate entrance but which the red Michelin indicates is associated with the Montecarlo. We ate there on our first night. The food and service were good but the bill, even for Venice, was very, very high.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: dr_read
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4-night stay at the Montecarlo Hotel in Venice. What really sticks in our minds is the friendly staff - each of the shifts on the front-desk were exceptionally friendly --- always a smile! The hotel is very central, approximately 2-4 minutes from St. Marco Square (depending on tourist traffic). The hotel was renovated in around '03 and so its more or less up-to-date --- the furniture remains traditional Venetian and seemed rather dated, but I guess this is just the style. Our bathroom only appeared to be partly renovated (still had funky tiles and a rather old shower) and the toilet seemed to continually trickle but I can't say this really bothered us. We found the room to be very clean. Breakfast was included in our 'deal' and it was perfectly adequate --- if only to avoid us from having to search for the nearest cafe first thing in the morning. Overall we found the hotel to be good value for money - we would recommend it to others and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice on a budget”
Reviews.Author: stainless1983
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a holiday on a budget then this hotel is a good find. On the door step to San Marc Sq, it really is a great location as it's only 10min slow walk to Rialto and 5mins to a choice of water stops. The hotel cost us Â£50 and Â£60 per night as we booked early through the best western website. Beds - I paid the small charge of Â£2extra for the kingsize room but the room was still tiny and the bed was actually two twins pushed together. Bathroom - Very ugly and the shower curtains are disuisting and annoying. Where as when we stayed at the Monaco Grand Canel last year and enjoyed many baths in the luxury bathrooms, this time we didn't have any as it just wasn't inviting at all. And there was a lingering smell from the drains which, unless you believe the rumours, is not a trademark of Venice. Concierge/Reception - Not very helpful and it seemed that most things were too much trouble for them. We asked them to book restaurants for us and it took around 5times before they did so for one of the restaurants. Television - No english speaking channel except for CNN and BBC World. At the monaco grand canal we enjoyed the fact that we could get ready listening to the music channel but it was not on the list of channels here. Breakfast - This is where the hotel picks up a few marks. I'm not a huge coffee fan but at this hotel i was impressed and looked forward to my morning coffee. The food is buffet style but food is warm and plenty. Sausages, bacon, eggs, ham, cheese, toast, yoghurts, croissants, cereals and juices are all available. The staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: misscappuccino
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel just off of San Marco Square, in the heart of the city. We stayed at the Montecarlo for 5 days we booked a triple and a double. The rooms we fantastic the decor was venetian and very nice Murano glass lighting to add a special touch. We paid 99,00 euros for the double and 124,00 euros for the triple. Great prices for Venice and for San Marco Square location. The rooms were spacious for european standards. The lift was very small, but then again the building is 500 years old, but beautiful. We had our rooms in the fron of the hotel overlooking the main street the hotel is on very charming. The hotel only offers room service for breakfast, we did not use it. They offer a wonderfull breakfast each morning with fresh to order cappuccino, espresso etc..they have eggs, meat links,cakes, cereal, dairy products, juice etc.. I just the fruit that was offered was fresh instead of the can variety. This hotel is a fantastic value for the money. Hotel is also close to all the major sights. Hotel is very clean and staff is excellent. I would recomend this hotel to anyone and would stay her again if I were to return to Venice. There is a good cafe close to hotel with no cover charge the cafe is Pizzeria Marciana, Calle Larga S. Marco 367 B. ---. the food is good priced the food is vsery good and the staff is friendly and helpfull. The cafe is just across the way from the MCDONALDS, it has yellow tablecloths seen from the window and a bunch of sunflowers in a vase near the cash register., the staff has white coats with black bow ties. Melinda Salinas, CA USA

Reviews.Title: “Little gem close to St Mark Square”
Reviews.Author: ecc35
Reviews.Content: General: I spent 3 days in this hotel (Jan 7 to 10) and I have to say that I was positively surprised by the whole experience. Location: It coudn't be better: 2 minute walk to St Mark's Square. Really, really impressive if you want to be in the heart of Venezia. Kind of tricky to find due to the narrow street where it lays but finding it was a little adventure. Stay away from the hotels surrounding the hotel: tourist traps! Dig into the narrow streets to find cheaper and better places. The main shopping areas are really close--easy to go back to the hotel and unload the shopping bags! Room: The size was okay, kind of small for US standards but the decor was authentic and it was really clean. The bathroom was very clean and very convenient. They had brand new flat-panel TVs hanging on top of the wall which I found great although some purist might say woun't match the Venezian decor. A nice assortment of channels was really nice to have too. Staff: Extremely nice and helpful. The night guy who checked us in--skinny tall guy with receding hairline (maybe Erasmo?) was out of this world--funny, knowledgable, multilingual and accomodating. A huge plus for this hotel to have this guy. Breakfast: Sort of repetitive but still good. Fresh coffee on demand, fresh croissants, eggs (hard to get), sausage, fruit, yogurt, etc. etc. I'd definitely come back to this place in the future. Price is not bad (90 euro/night) for the kind of rip-offs you get in Venice. EJCC

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Best Location in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: rentthisplace
Reviews.Content: Best Western Montecarlo could not be in a better spot for visitors to beautiful Venice. Just a few turns from Saint Mark's square, this hotel puts you in the heart of Venice. Forget what others in the Venice forum say about avoiding the square in winter, it's not flooded all the time, and the Venetians have thought of ways to get around anyway. This small hotel has professional staff, and great service. The included breakfast saved us bundles, though could use a little variety. The rooms were pure Venice and the bathrooms are very recently remodelled. We felt quite at home and found this to be affordable even whilst renting 2 rooms for our family of 4. Everything is closeby from the Montecarlo!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money by Ventian standards”
Reviews.Author: ASG
Reviews.Content: I read all the previous reviews before booking this hotel, and I think they gave a good assessment. It is not the best hotel I have ever stayed in, but is certainly not bad at all for Venice, where just about everything is a rip off. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly and the rooms are clean. We paid a bit extra (we booked direct on the Best Western website) and had a spacious room. The decor is a bit tired but the bed was comfortable enough and it was definitely clean. The location is excellent too. Breakfast was very average but plentiful enough. The dining room was crowded and we were staying in a very quiet period. We ate at Da Ignazio and had the best 'fritto misto' of our lives. The price was very, very reasonable too and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, yet again”
Reviews.Author: Travelgyrl71
Reviews.Content: Once again, my family and I stayed at the MonteCarlo (October 29-November 2) and loved it. As usual the staff was helpful and very friendly - especially the night clerk Ersamo (sorry if I spelled it wrong). The hotel was very patient with the many changes that we made with reservations and upon arrival everything was PERFECT. It is the best value for the area and we plan to stay here again next year. The rooms are large based on European standards (405,408 and 413) and very clean. Breakfast offered excellent coffee and hot selections. Wi-fi is available in the lobby for only 5 Euros (for 30 minutes - great for the convenience). To the staff at the MonteCarlo - many thanks for making my mother's vacation special once again.

Reviews.Title: “Just remember the location”
Reviews.Author: TripAnorak
Reviews.Content: This hotel has several major negatives. It is tired-looking with a rather faded 1960s decor, the rooms are small and have a faintly damp smell (but they are clean) and the buffet breakfast is unadventurous and something of an unholy scrum if you arrive at 9am when all the Americans are stampeding towards the scrambled eggs. But the service is very good, especially at reception where the staff are always polite and helpful. And above all you are unlikely to find a half-decent 3-star hotel so near to the sights - 2 minutes from Piazza San Marco and 10 minutes from the Rialto. We chose this hotel because of its central location and the fact that it had a lift - invaluable for my septuagarian mother-in-law. We would probably stay there again. And yes, you can hear bells, but hey, this is Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bigbearmama
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with this hotel. The room was very large and clean. The hotel staff were very accommodating, helpful and pleasant at all times. The breakfast was the best we had in Europe. The location was incredible. We were so pleased that we requested an extra night. I am very confident in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, OK for a short visit”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for St Marks Square. If you like church bells you'll like this place! We had a tiny box of a room, but the bed was comfortable and the flat screen TV was good. The en suite was also small and the shower was not too impressive with a plastic curtain. My wife flooded the bedroom carpet. Staff were really friendly and room cleanliness good. Breakfast was good. We did the "free" Murano glass works tour but declined to buy a plate for 8000 euros. The hotel is a good base for a short stay. Venice is expensive, and you get what you pay for. Better value can be obtained, but not so close to St Marks. Next time we might stay further away but seek more space.

Reviews.Title: “Venice's Best Western MonteCarlo Shines”
Reviews.Author: D-djourneys
Reviews.Content: The Best Western MonteCarlo just off St. Mark's square in Venice is a great place to stay. First of all it is located within a block of St. Mark's square. Make a left, out the door, and the street ends at San Marco. Several good restaurants are very close and the Rialto Bridge area is less than 10 minutes away. Second, it is very well run. The desk staff are a lot of fun and very helpful. The included breakfast is hot and delicious. The rooms are neat, clean, quiet and spacious for Euro hotels. A small in house bar makes it easy to relax. A 110 converter was available to recharge our camera and phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: debsbmw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel prior to a cruise we were taking. It was a great location to Saint Marks Square and all of the shopping. The rooms were clean and the breakfasts were very good that are included in the price. We were on the third floor and as some prior reviews stae it did not stay as cool on this floor as the others. Our room did not have a shower curtain, which we thought was odd. The daytime staff was much friendlier than the evening staff, but overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Skamom
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and chose this hotel on reviews of others. We were very pleased we did! The location is around the block from Plaza San Marco, so it's near all the touristy locations and easy walking distance to everything. We had a triple room which was a nice size. The breakfast was plenty and enjoyable. The staff was always friendly and helfpful. We felt that this hotel surprassed our expectations and would highly recommend it. It was definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DKD
Reviews.Content: We started our European tour in Venice and really enjoyed the Montecarlo. The room was very nice, the staff was helpful and friendly and the breakfast was good as well. The only downside was that, though the room was air conditioned, it wasn't as cool at night as we'd like. Also, like lots of Venice locations, lugging our bags over cobblestones and bridges was a bit of a challenge. But the Montecarlo was just steps from St. Mark's Square, which is exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Horrible Night Receptionist (be warned!)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend, twin sister and I stayed in the Montecarlo for 4 nights between 8th July 2006 to 12th July 2006 (very recently then!). As far as the general look of the hotel and its dÃ©cor - it was very nice. We stayed in a triple room that was actually a double with a strange cot-like bed that my friend had to sleep in. She says she found it comfortable but did have some problems with her back because of it. The gentleman on reception during the day was wonderful - polite, friendly and even remembering our room number each and every time we went to get our key. However the gentleman on during the night was very rude indeed. Many times he would respond to us asking for our key by slamming it on the counter. One night the gentleman on the day reception was still there chatting to the night man when he saw us enter the hotel, on asking for our key he said jokingly to the night receptionist 'How could you forget these ladies are in room 107?', to which the night receptionist replied ' To me they are just clients'! We were very offended indeed. Then when we were leaving he spent ages printing our bill and counting the cash we had given him, he also didnâ€™t bother to hold the door open for us after we had tipped him 5 euros! Incredible! The hotel itself is in brilliant location, not just for St Marks Square, but also for all areas of Venice. San Polo and Santa Croche are accessible via the Rialto Bridge, which is about 5 mins walk from the hotel. Note a piece of advice about anyone purchasing a 'Rolling Venice' card - these cards are good for the civic museums, but wont get you in the Accademia Gallery. We werenâ€™t told this when we bought them, which was very annoying. The tickets cost 22 euros but that price is worth it just for Doge's Palace alone. If you can, go on the Secret Itineraries tour to view Casanovaâ€™s jail cell - we didnâ€™t do this and wished we had! All in all Venice is a wonderful place, not only did we have a wonderful time but we also had the advantage of watching the Italians win the world cup, while standing in a beautiful square in San Polo! Once in a lifetime experience. Finally, despite its expense, itâ€™s worth going to Harry's Bar for a Bellini. The atmosphere is amazing! xxx

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Wexler
Reviews.Content: Beyond the very good location, the nice room and the breakfast, what stood out for us was the staff. Very friendly, very accommodating and very helpful. For me, that's all I could ask for in a foreign land. The hotel is close to St. Marks, and about 5 minutes from the Rialto Bridge (main tourist shopping). Venice is not a big place to begin with, so as good as the location is relative to those two points, if you don't mind walking - which is all you do in Venice - location really isn't high on my evaluation list. The main part of the room was very good. High ceilings, nice lighting fixture, big window that looked out to the alley below. The bathroom was on the smaller side. There was one item of contention - the shower curtain - which would literally attack you while showering...in our room the shower stall was like a box on the floor enclosed by a vinyl shower curtain that if the wind blew the right way, for whatever reason, you would be encased in shower curtain...stuck to you...kinda gross while trying to get clean, but none the less we worked through it. And this certainly did not affect the way we felt overall about the hotel. The breakfast was fine. All the standards. The Staff. When we arrived - after taking an over night train from Paris to Venice and the #82 water bus to the St Marks landing, then walking our luggage through the hustle and bustle of St. Marks...we found the Best Western Montecarlo. Oh, I must add that there are street signs that CLEARLY mark where the hotel is located - which was a plus. We were greeted by a much needed smile. Forget his name - taller, skinny guy with very short hair - super nice, very informative, very friendly, spoke English very well. Made all the difference in the world after our adventure trying to get there. Each front desk person was very helpful when we would ask for non-touristy dinner spots...and, although we didn't have a chance to use this feature, I am pretty sure the Hotel offers free transportation to Murano - don't quote me on that, inquire with your very friendly front desk person. Venice is a wonderful place...arguably one of the most special places on the planet...and the Best Western Montecarlo was key in our experience. I would definitely stay there again, and next time maybe I would look into that trip to Murano... Oh, we used a Street Wise Map - it was incredibly helpful in navigating the island, highly suggested.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Britleo
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Venice and having experienced some below standard hotels, this was a delightful change. Excellent location for St Marks Square and very helpful staff, who also had a great sense of humour. Most hotel rooms in Venice are small, but this was most acceptable and well furnished. Air Conditioning and two windows overlooking the narrow alleyway. Plenty of good restaurants within 100 yards. Be careful of going for tourist menus at Venetian restaurants, as it is usually best to pay the extra and get a good meal.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindalumps
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary. The 5 days were brilliant (12th - 16th May 2006). The location is wonderful, three minutes from St Mark's Square! This is very important when trying to find your way back from a day's site-seeing! I would not advise eating anywhere on or near the Square: unless the firm's paying!! Also if you don't like pigeons it probably is not the best place to stand! Get to the Basilica early otherwise you will have a long wait. We got there at 9am for a 9.45am opening and we were 3rd in line. When you leave the lower ground of the Basilica be careful not to walk out but turn back to where you came in...... there are steps leading to upstairs: not to be missed. A lot of people missed this and were disappointed when they came out because there is no way back. The sights from the Campinile are brilliant: there is a lift! The hotel room was on the 4th floor: quiet except for the bells ringing. We found this quite romantic for a few days!! Our room was decorated in typically Venetian style with a King Size bed and quaint furniture. There was an alarm clock and TV(didn't use that) and the bathroom was beautiful. Bedding, towels and bath mat were changed every day and once they even changed the shower curtain! Breakfast was fine: fresh fruit salad, fruit juices, yoghurts, croissants, bread, ham, cheese, cereals, sausages, eggs and coffee. Staff were always pleasant, (remember if you are a couple to sit to the left as you go in) other side is for larger groups. Receptionist were helpful, polite and thankfully, spoke English! I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Location is ideal and the price we found to compare favourably with other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycurbangirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. It was a perfect location for the major sights in Venice. The staff was extremely helpful and they went out of their way to provide us with the best information. They have internet access there, so we were able to book out train reservations online. Breakfast was also very good. Rooms were good sized - we stayed in a triple and were comfortable. You are a 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Square, Doge's Palace and the Basilica. There was a good restaurant to the left of the hotel, I believe it was Ristorante Pizzeria Centrale. I would avoid the restaurants that have the tourist price fixe menu - as food was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by it being a Best Western, this was the nicest hotel we stayed in throughout Italy! Two blocks behind St. Mark's Square, it was in the perfect location (particularly when a public WC couldn't be found). The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, even after we had observed some difficult guest encounters. The room was really lovely, and the bathroom was fabulous! The largest bathroom we had seen yet... it even had two sinks. We were on the top floor, which had lower ceilings and thus a bit of a "fun house" feel, but it was wonderfully quiet and peaceful. The breakfast was very nice, the dining room was nearly full each morning. We would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: satkin02
Reviews.Content: Very convenient hotel but the room we had (#110) was incredibly cramped, dated and dingy (lighting was awful). The bathroom was small but newly renovated, clean, and well lit. Other rooms may be better -- we only stayed one night so I suspect we got the worst room. I wouldn't stay there again...for moderately more money we got a MUCH nicer room at the Westin Europa and Regina.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very helpful and breakfast was very good.To use computer in lobby was 5 euro for 30 min not 50.Location was perfect for walking.Get a good map of venice and just walk.Hotel had free trip to murono glass company.After you visit factory tell them you don't want to go back now and tour the shops on the island.Only thing about hotel was we reserved a triple and all they did was add a bed to a double room.Didn't spend much time in room except to sleep so that wasn't much of a problem.Room and bathroom were very clean and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent and was situated within 2 minutes walk of St Marks Square and 5 minutes to the Rialto Bridge. Bridge of Sighs 10 minutes away. It is centrally placed to everywhere you would want to go in Venice. Rooms in the hotel were great - very clean and a much higher standard than we had anticipated. Bathrooms were lovely and clean. Hotel staff were very friendly and enjoyed our "attempts" at basic Italian! Breakfast was served 7am - 10am which suited us and plenty to eat. Definately recommend the hotel - Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlos hotel is one of my favorites now. the staff is amazing. specially the noctural receptionist! they are extremely friendly, and willing to help. the location is GReat..close to MAJOR SITES..I would defenitely recommend it to people. I actually went back in February 2006 and stayed there again, because i loved it soo much!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, conveniently placed and value for money”
Reviews.Author: r46fy4hf03ndg3t
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, good location for S Marco, tacky decor (but as another reviewer has said, part of its charm). One or two moments of being able to hear some noise from rooms above and adjacent but hey, that can happen anywhere. I would definitely recommend it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brunlea
Reviews.Content: Very close to San Marco. Our room (209) was large by Venice standards & with a good bathroom. Staff very friendly & helpful and breakfasts not bad. We got a very good price off season & I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location! would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jofroberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Jan 2006. would rate it as excellent. Perfect location for a good price, Really good breakfast - hot food as well as continental. Rooms snall but were fine, very clean, ventian style decor, good balcony with view down the street which was lit by little fairy style lights in the evening. TV in room, and staff were all helpful. would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good til the end”
Reviews.Author: bvicritter
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. Totally tacky decor but that was part of the charm. Breakfast was good, location is IDEAL! The staff were all nice until the very last one we were in contact with. We were doing our checkout and needed to do it quickly to catch the boat to the trainstation. We came downstairs and he told us that we were going to have to wait for a five minutes while his printing finished off. during this time he was very rude and wanted us to go away from the desk as he thought we were looking at his printing. After five minutes and then some still printing. I told him that we had a train to catch and could he please hurry up. It started into a mini head to head and luckily enough i have a cool enough head at that time of the morning. by the time he finished printing i got my reciept and he then had the nerve to question why i wanted a reciept! Lucky for him my time was running out and i needed to catch the ferry. No thank you's or hope you enjoyed your stay or hope you come back one day. Just a very sour note to leave on. Would be a great place to stay... just hope you dont run into that guy at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Drmaz
