Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights in the Best Western Montecarlo in Venice and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The hotel is ideally situated on a small Venician street, lined with curious boutiques, and is literally 30 seconds walk from St. Mark's Square. Our room was elaborately decorated and had three huge French doors providing a quaint view over the rooftops of the neighbouring palazzos. The hotel was very clean - the bed linen and bath towels were changed daily. Don't be put off by the fact the hotel is a Best Western - one still experiences the ambience of a true Venecian residence but with the added security and quality of a worldwide hotel chain. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: mar11beth
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the staff. They are very friendly and polite. The room on the other hand was the smallest rooms I've ever come across. It was a box. A rather dark box with dark walls. The bed just fits in the room! The shower you could hardly move at all it was so snug. The shower also had a window which allows people to see you showering so we had to cover that up with a towel while we showered. The TV was nice though. It was a plasma flat screen mounted on the wall. The hotel also has the smallest elevator I've come across. Warning... don't get dooped into the Murano free tour on Sundays offered by the hotel. The tour was good. Just don't buy anything from there. They charge like 4 times more for the same thing you can get in Venice. Yes... we've learned our lesson.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The rooms were clean and cozy, the staff was friendly, and the location could not have been more convenient. A great complimentary, hot breakfast (scrambled eggs, sausage) was served every morning and the coffe was wonderful. After a full day of siteseeing, it was such a comfort to come back to the Montecarlo to collapse! If we ever have the good fortune to return to Venice, we will also be returning to the Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “You can use the toilet and the bidet at the same time”
Reviews.Author: EastofHampstead
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before returning home. The best things about this hotel were the staff, who were all friendly and helpful and spoke good English and the location - a stones throw from the Piazza San Marco. On the down side the room we stayed in was a little bit cramped and the bed was small, to use the toilet in the bathroom required skillful maneuvering - you could sit on the loo whilst washing your feet in the bidet! It was okay for one night but wouldn't have liked to stay there for any length of time.

Reviews.Title: “great location, shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to get a king size bed, we only had a double. The decor was horrible. The room was just grim, however it was clean. The bathroom look ok but it was difficult to shower in such a small space. AND when you did shower the water flooded straight in to the bedroom. So much fun walking about on a soaking wet carpet. The staffs were helpful and friendly though but there is so much choice of hotels that i wouldn't bother staying here again, and it wasn't cheap in comparison to some of the others. The location is perfect though. Your right in ther heart of everything 2 mins from the main square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but crowded area.”
Reviews.Author: kmf4003
Reviews.Content: Above average hotel just steps from San Marco Square. Clean rooms, good breakfast. The only downfall to this hotel is trying to get to it through the crowds, especially with luggage! Research how to get to hotel from water bus.

Reviews.Title: “good location-once you find the street”
Reviews.Author: DotAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms at the hotel after a cruise. all rooms were slightly different but very nicely deocorated with the venetian glass and very nice furniture. Staff was helpful, spoke satisfactory English. We had no problem with breakfast, possibly because it was early. Staff very helpful in arranging transportation to the water taxi to the airport. Location of the hotel is great for all the walking and sightseeing in Venice. We would most certainly recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable, great location and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've traveled a lot and the Monte Carlo is definitely one of the better hotels I have stayed at. I was there for 5 days/nights and it was a great experience. The room was a bit small, but very comfortable, charming, nicely furnished and pleasant. Very clean room/bathroom. The local is excellent, only a couple of minutes' walk away from St. Mark's Place. There's a bit of a walk from the water taxi docking place to the hotel door when you arrive with your luggage, but the hotel sent out a staff member to help bring it in so we had no problem at all. Generally the staff was very friendly and helpful. My parents, who were traveling with me, initially got a room they weren't happy with, on the top floor -- it was too small, with a very low ceiling and rather stuffy, but when they complained about it to the staff they were promptly moved into an excellent 2nd floor room. The only drawback as far as I'm concerned was that the breakfast buffet didn't have a great selection, but it was okay. Generally you definitely get more than your money's worth with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Montecarlo in September of 2004. Our room was a little small, but decorated so nicely. It was also very comfortable and clean. We found the hotel staff very helpful & they spoke English. We also really enjoyed the Breakfast. Maybe it was the time we traveled, but we never had to wait for a seat or for food & coffee. We stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels in Rome and Florence and thought the Breakfast and accomedations were the best in Venice, we were very pleased. Also, the location was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: DancerDevon_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an unbeatable location, just a minute from St Mark's Square, is very clean, comfortable and convenient. The breakfast room is too small for the number of rooms and we had to queue each morning to be seated, but contrary to other reviews, there was no shortage of food and it was all replenished. However, it is a little boring and some variety with the hot food would be good. Staff were friendly and reception staff spoke excellent English. We didn't take the free boat trip to Morano (having been scared off by some reviews) but heard 2 sets of guests complaining (separately - different days) to the management about being pressurised to buy glass on Morano, one couple saying that staff on the island wouldn't let them board the return boat because they hadn't bought, and another woman complaining that the trip was too long, taking up too much of the day. Apparently there is an arrangement that hotel guests get a 10% discount on meals in the restaurant next door, but the staff didn't inform us of this, nor did they tell us about the regatta on the Grand Canal on Sunday. Having said all that, we would definitely use this hotel again. There aren't many frills, but it's good for a short stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Location of the Hotel is fantastic, 2 minutes from St Marks Square - we got up at 7 am for a walk before breakfast - had the whole square to ourselves and watched the sun come up! Fantastic. The staff were really helpful and friendly and the room was great-decorated really well and the bathroom included a fab power shower. I wouldn't recommend eating in the immediate area of the hotel- as it is in the hub of everything prices are high and quality low. Walk a few blocks away from the square- you don't even need to go that far to find where more locals eat and drink- these places are much better value.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant locatation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel couldn't be in a better location. Easy to get to from waterbus. Very new and clean bathrooms. Staff are very helpful with excellent English. Rooms are venetian style. We truly enjoyed our 2 night stay. Breakfast was ok, not a big selection but none the less fine. Would stay again if going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Monte Carlo for 4 nights 17th Feb to 21st, good sized room,very clean. Reception staff couldn't have been more helpful. Breakfast good. This is good priced Hotel in a very good location. Don't take the free trip to Murano unless you want to be hounded to buy something at rip off prices,also the free trip back only took us to the nearest point in Venice which was a long way from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the montecarlo in january 2005 and loved it staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for you very convenient location is close to many sights and is easy to find from the water bus. the only downside is that the continental breakfast is the same every day and can become a little dull. the rooms were very clean due to the maids being in every day including sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Europe!”
Reviews.Author: anon789
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel, especially at offseason rates. The GOOD: 1. Cheap rates in winter. 2. Less than a block from San Marco square. 3. Very friendly, helpful staff. Speak very good English. 4. Offer free trip to Murano glass factory. 5. Attractive venetian style rooms. 6. Excellent, complimentary buffet breakfast. 7. Reasonably priced minibar. 8. Great neighborhood. The BAD: 1. Tiny shower that gets water everywhere. 2. Room was a little small, but aren't they all in Europe?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, serviceable”
Reviews.Author: uzubuzu
Reviews.Content: Two couples stayed at the Bestwestern Hotel Monte Carlo in Oct 2004 for two nights. It is in a convienient location right behind St.Mark's Square (but it wasn't easy when we arrived since all the streets were flooded). The rooms are on the smallish side which seems not uncommon for European hotels but it was accurate as pictured on their website. The bathroom was very tiny. The continental breakfast was fine. The staff was pleasant. We don't stay in Bestwesterns in the States but we were assured they are of different quality abroad. I can't disagree with that because they tend to renovate older hotels abroad. A bigger room and bathroom would have been more satisfying but you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position”
Reviews.Author: julieinwinchester
Reviews.Content: What on earth do people find to complain about, tepid capuccino! For goodness sake you're in Italy, that's how they like it. Next time ask for it to be hot, they won't bite. This was a great hotel, we stayed 2 nights on Nov 12 and 13 for my birthday treat and it was a treat. We could see the Bell Tower from our room, which incidentally was more than adequate. If you want home comforts stay at home! Having said that it was charming. Oh and the staff, well they were wonderful and particulary liked the British. Probably because we're polite! Incidentally we had a meal at Harry's Bar, the world famous bar and restaurant. The most expensive meal we have ever ever ever had and in my humble opinion, not worth it. But do have a drink in Hotel Danielli.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms. Brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. It's a few meters from the square. However, our room was really small even by European standards. No bath, just a shower. I could not sit on the toilet without hitting the toilet paper dispenser. I would probably look at a 4-star if I returned to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montecarlo for one night in Nov. The hotel is in a great location just behind St. Mark's Sq and only a few minutes walk for Varessero on the water bus 82 or 1. The rooms were clean, well looked after and everything was in order. The staff spoke English and breakfast was very good. Overall an excellent hotel, worth the money and I have no problems in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location!”
Reviews.Author: JohnCol
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at this Hotel. October is very nice in Venice, although we did not expect so much flooding, which was quite bad. Can't believe how busy it was for this time of year. The Hotel is great. The best thing is its situation. We could see the Campanile out of our window. Very convenient for St. Mark's Square, the Rialto and loads of shops and restaurants. It's nice and quite except when the bells chime at 7.00am and the flood alarm goes off some mornings. It's a nicely decorated, clean Hotel, and the staff speak perfect English and are very pleasant. The Restaurant only serves breakfasts at this time of year but these aren't too bad, although a bit more variety wouldn't go amiss. Service is good. We had some very expensive, ordinary meals in the local tourist area. It's best to keep to the set menues if you want to eat nearby. However, if you look look further afield, the food can be very good and reasonable. Part of the fun is going out in the evening looking for somewhere to eat. There's no shortage of places. Coffee's quite expensive in the bars and its usually cheaper to have the local beer, which is very good. Had to have a cocktail in Harry's Bar. It's a disappointing place as far as decor goes, but it's strong on atmosphere. Expect to pay about 13-14 Euros for a cocktail if you sit at the bar, but the service is excellent. All in all a great Hotel in a wonderful City. Could have done with a few more days!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Montecarlo
HotelInfo.Address: Calle degli Specchieri 463 | San Marco, 30124 Venice, Italy
